directions.1: Using a small-hole strainer, drain liquid from salsa; discard liquid.
directions.2: Transfer leftover tomato mixture to a medium bowl.
directions.3: Mix in black beans, cheese, and cilantro until combined.
directions.4: Divide black bean mixture evenly over half of each tortilla (about 1/2 cup each).
directions.5: Fold tortillas in half.
directions.6: Heat large griddle or skillet over medium-high heat.
directions.7: Brush with oil.
directions.8: Place filled tortillas on a griddle.
directions.9: Cook, carefully flipping once, until tortillas are gold brown and crisp and cheese filling melts, about 5 minutes.
directions.10: Cut quesadillas into wedges.

3 tablespoons rice vinegar (can use other vinegar such as red wine vinegar or apple cider vinegar)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain and rinse beans.
directions.3: Put beans and tomatoes into large mixing bowl.
directions.4: Dice peppers, onion, and garlic. Add to mixing bowl.
directions.5: Mix cumin, cilantro, and vinegar. Pour on top of beans and vegetables.

ingredients: 2 teaspoons chili powder (or more to taste)
3 cans (15.5 ounce) low-sodium black beans (drained and rinsed in cold water, or use 6 cups cooked (dried) black beans)
Black Bean Soup.notes:
Garnish black bean soup with lime slices, chopped fresh cilantro, basil leaves, or scallions.

directions.1: Place a soup or stock pot on the stove over medium heat and when it is hot, add the oil. Add an onion, carrots, celery, garlic, basil, oregano, and chili powder and cook about 10 minutes until the onion is soft.
directions.2: Add the beans, water, and bouillon cube and raise the heat to high and bring to a boil. Turn the heat down to low and cook about 2 1/2 hours until the beans are very tender and the mixture is uniform in color.
directions.3: If you want a pureed soup, set the soup aside to cool for about 20 minutes. Put 2 cups soup in a blender and put the top on, halfway (this will allow the soup to expand and any steam to escape) and blend until smooth. Transfer to a large container. Repeat using the rest of the soup.
directions.4: Just before serving, squeeze the juice of 1/4 lime on each serving and a tablespoon of yogurt.
directions.5: Serve right away, or cover and refrigerate up to 5 days.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Carefully drain the juice from one can of black beans. Pour the drained black beans into a bowl. Use a potato masher to mash the beans until they are no longer whole. Set the mashed beans aside.
directions.3: Chop the onion in to 1/4-inch pieces. Set it aside. Peel the garlic cloves and mince them finely. Set the garlic aside.
directions.4: In a medium saucepan, heat the oil over medium high heat. Add the onions and sauté for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cumin and cook for 30 seconds more. Stir in the mashed black beans and the second can of black beans, including the juice. When the beans begin to boil, reduce the heat to low, stir in the salt and oregano and simmer for 10 minutes, uncovered.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Partially freeze beef. Thinly slice across the grain into long strips 1/8 inch thick and 3 inches wide.
directions.3: Combine paprika, oregano, chili powder, garlic powder, black pepper, red pepper, and dry mustard. Coat strips of meat with the spice mixture.
directions.4: Spray a large heavy skillet nonstick cooking spray. Preheat pan over high heat.
directions.5: Add meat; cook, stirring for 5 minutes.
directions.6: Add potatoes, onion, broth, and garlic. Cook covered, over medium heat for 20 minutes.
directions.7: Stir in carrots, lay greens over top and cook, covered, until carrots are tender, about 15 minutes.

ingredients: 3 cups collard greens, stems removed and chopped (1/2 pound)
1 can (14.5 oz) broth (fat-free, low sodium chicken or vegetable)
2 cans black-eyed peas, low-sodium, drained and rinsed (or 4 cups)
Black-Eyed Pea and Collard Greens Soup.notes:
* Preparing collard greens: First, remove any damaged outer leaves. Fill a large bowl with cold water, and dunk the greens. Swish them around for a few minutes to help loosen any dirt on the leaves. Pour out the dirty water and fill the bowl with clean water. Swish the leaves under the clean water again to remove any additional dirt. Continue this process until the water in the bowl remains clear. To cut collard greens, fold each leaf in half with the stem at the fold crease. Either cut or tear the stem off.  Stack several leaves on top of each other and roll the leaves up. Cut the roll of leaves in 1 inch thick pieces.
Be Creative! - Top with shredded cheese!

Learn more about:

Onions
Collard Greens

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash the collard greens.*
directions.3: Drain and rinse the black-eyed peas.
directions.4: Collect, chop, dice, and measure all ingredients before starting to prepare the recipe.
directions.5: Place oil, onion, garlic, and ham in a large pot with a lid over medium heat. Stir occasionally until onion is clear, about 3 to 5 minutes.
directions.6: Add collard greens and broth to the pot.
directions.7: Cover and simmer for about 20 minutes until the collard greens are tender.
directions.8: Place half of the black-eyed peas in a small bowl, and mash with a fork. Stir the mashed and whole peas into the soup. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
directions.9: Taste, and add a small amount of salt and black pepper if desired.
directions.10: Stir in vinegar just before serving.
directions.11: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours. Eat within 3 to 5 days.

ingredients: 2 cups blue cornmeal (yellow may be used)
Blue Corn Pan Bread.notes: To sprout wheat: Wash untreated wheat grains; drain, but do not dry. Spread in a single layer in shallow pans and cover with damp cloths. Keep damp in a warm, dark place.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 300 °F. Line 8x8 inch cake pan with foil.
directions.3: Bring water to boil in a large pot. Add each ingredient, one at a time.
directions.4: Stir well until mixture is smooth and pour into foil-lined cake pan. Cover with a piece of aluminum foil.
directions.5: Bake for 2 hours. Bread is done when toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.

ingredients: 1 egg (or 2 tablespoons egg mix + 1/4 cup water)
Blue Cornmeal Pancakes.notes: This recipe contains one or more ingredients considered to be traditional or indigenous to Native American communities in certain regions across North America.

directions.1: In a large bowl, mix the cornmeal and salt. Stir in the boiling water until the ingredients are wet. Cover and let stand for 3 minutes.
directions.2: In a separate bowl, mix the milk, melted margarine, and egg or egg mix and water mixture. Add to the cornmeal mixture.
directions.3: Add flour and baking powder to the bowl and mix until combined.
directions.4: Heat a large skillet over medium heat and spray with cooking spray.
directions.5: Spoon ¼ cup of the batter on the skillet. When bubbles appear, flip, and cook the other side until golden brown. Serve with syrup, honey, yogurt, or fresh fruit if desired.

directions.1: Blend vinaigrette ingredients in a blender, set aside.
directions.2: In a medium size bowl, toss all ingredients with dressing.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 375 °F.
directions.3: Grease the muffin pans.
directions.4: In a large mixing bowl, stir the oil and sugar until creamy.

directions.8: Bake uncovered at 325 °F for 1 to 1 1/4 hours, or until center is firm and lightly browned.

ingredients: 1 package 10-ounce frozen spinach (or 1 bunch fresh spinach)
Braised Chicken Thighs with Spinach.notes:

directions.1: Heat skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 teaspoon oil. Add chicken, top side down. Cook about 8 minutes on each side, or until deeply browned. Remove the chicken to a dinner plate and set aside.
directions.2: Reheat skillet over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, thyme, and rosemary. Cook about 5 minutes, until the onion is soft and golden. Return the chicken to the pan.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.

directions.3: Put flour in a large bowl. Add salt, baking soda, and sugar. Mix well.
directions.4: Stir in the bran flake cereal. Mix well.
directions.5: Make a well in the center of mixture and set aside.
directions.6: In another bowl, beat the egg, buttermilk, and oil together.
directions.7: Pour the egg mixture into the well of the cereal mixture and stir until all ingredients are moist. Do not over mix.
directions.8: Fill the tins 2/3 full.
directions.9: Bake for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown.
directions.10: If not eaten right away, wrap the baked muffins in foil or a plastic bag and store in the freezer. Thaw for 15 seconds in the microwave or overnight in the refrigerator.

ingredients: 6 sprays of vegetable oil spray (or oil)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Measure flour into 1-gallon container.
directions.3: Add salt, soda, sugar and raisin bran to the flour and mix well with spoon.
directions.4: With a spoon make a "well" in the center of the dry ingredients.

ingredients: 2 cups flour (all-purpose, plus extra for kneading)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine flour, whole wheat flour, yeast, sugar, salt and powdered milk in a one gallon resealable freezer bag. Squeeze upper part of bag to force out air and seal bag. Shake and work bag with fingers to blend ingredients.
directions.3: Add oil and warm water to dry ingredients. Reseal bag. Mix by working bag with fingers until dough is completely mixed and pulls away from bag.
directions.4: On a floured surface, knead dough 5 minutes or until smooth and elastic, adding flour as needed. Put dough back into bag and let it rest 10 minutes.
directions.5: Shape dough on greased baking sheet or put into a 4x8 inch greased loaf pan. Cover with a clean cloth or plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in bulk.
directions.6: Preheat oven to 350 °F and bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. (This may take between 25 and 45 minutes to bake.)
directions.7: Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack or clean dish towel.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Melt margarine in a medium sized skillet.
directions.3: Tear bread in pieces and spread on bottom of skillet.
directions.4: Beat eggs and stir in sugar, salt, warmed milk and vanilla. Sprinkle raisins over bread and pour egg mixture over all.
directions.5: Cover and cook over very low heat for 20 minutes.
directions.6: Pudding is done when custard is set in the middle.
directions.7: Allow to cool in the skillet.
directions.8: Prepare vanilla sauce while pudding cools.
directions.9: Combine cornstarch and sugar in a small saucepan. Gradually add water, stirring well.
directions.10: Cook until thick and clear, stirring constantly.
directions.11: Add margarine and vanilla, stirring until margarine melts.
directions.12: Spoon over individual servings of bread pudding.
directions.13: Refrigerate leftover bread pudding and vanilla sauce within two hours.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Bring water to boil in medium saucepan. Stir in bulgur, parsley, minced onion, and soy sauce. Cover and reduce heat; simmer 15-20 minutes (until all water is absorbed and bulgur is not too crunchy). Do not overcook.
directions.3: Remove from heat and allow to cool; fluff with fork.
directions.4: Combine dressing ingredients; stir well. Pour over bulgur mixture and mix well.
directions.5: Stir in scallions, raisins, carrots, and chickpeas. Cover and chill for several hours. Store in refrigerator.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Clean celery with vegetable brush under cool running water.
directions.3: Cut celery in half cross wise.
directions.4: Fill center of each celery stick with one tablespoon of peanut butter. This is the body of the butterfly
directions.5: Add two pretzels to form the butterfly’s wings.
directions.6: Use extra pretzel pieces for antenna and raisins for decoration.

Buttermilk Scones.notes:
Substitute vegetable oil for the butter to reduce saturated fat.
Try other dried fruit.
Sprinkle with cinnamon before baking.
Try mixing in 1 1/2 teaspoons grated lemon or orange zest (grate the outer colored part of the peel).
No buttermilk? Place 1 tablespoon of lemon juice or vinegar in measuring cup and fill to the 1 cup line with milk. Stir and let set to thicken slightly.
Whole wheat flour can be replaced with all-purpose flour.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Combine the flours, sugar, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Mix well.
directions.4: Add raisins and mix lightly.
directions.5: In a small bowl, combine melted butter and buttermilk. Add liquid ingredients to flour mixture; mix gently.
directions.6: Spoon dough into 9 equal mounds on a greased baking sheet. Bake until well browned, 18 to 20 minutes.
directions.7: Serve hot or at room temperature. Best eaten the same day you bake them.

ingredients: 2 3/4 cups butternut squash, cubed (1 small squash, about 1 pound)
2 cans black beans, low-sodium (15.5 ounces each, rinsed and drained)
Butternut Squash with Black Beans.notes:
Learn more about:

Winter Squash
Onions
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat the squash in the microwave on high heat for 1 to 2 minutes. This will soften the skin.
directions.3: Carefully peel the squash with a vegetable peeler or small knife.
directions.4: Cut the squash into 1/2 inch cubes.
directions.5: Peel and chop the onion.
directions.6: In a large pan, heat the oil. Add the onion, garlic powder, and squash.
directions.7: Cook for 5 minutes on medium heat.
directions.8: Add vinegar and water. Cook on low heat until the squash is tender, about 10 minutes.
directions.9: Add the beans and oregano. Cook until the beans are heated through.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oil in a large sauté pan.
directions.3: Sauté onion over medium heat, until light brown, about 5 to 6 minutes.
directions.4: Add sliced cabbage, salt, black pepper, and caraway seeds.
directions.5: Stir and cook for 30 minutes.
directions.6: Serve immediately.

ingredients: 1 1/2 cups tomato sauce, low-sodium (or tomato juice)
1 cabbage head (small to medium, chopped in bite-sized pieces)
Cabbage Roll Casserole.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Tomatoes
Cabbage

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Brown ground beef in a skillet with onion and garlic. Drain off any fat.
directions.3: Place meat in a large pot and add water, tomatoes, tomato sauce (or juice), and cabbage. Cook until cabbage is almost tender.
directions.4: Add minute rice and cook five minutes longer. Serve.

ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon dill, dried (or basil or parsley)
Cabbage Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Cabbage
Carrots
Celery
Bell Peppers
Onions
Herbs
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash and prepare vegetables for chopping.
directions.3: Use a cheese grater or slice all vegetables thinly with a sharp knife.
directions.4: Put in a large bowl.
directions.5: Add herbs to taste.
directions.6: Mix mayonnaise, yogurt, mustard, lemon juice, and sugar in a small bowl. Blend well. Add to vegetables.
directions.7: Mix well. Keep in refrigerator until ready to eat.

ingredients: 2 cloves garlic (chopped, or 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder)
Cabbage Stir-Fry.notes:
Two cloves garlic and 2 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce used in nutrition analysis.
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Cabbage
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash green peppers and cabbage before chopping.
directions.3: Heat oil in a large skillet.
directions.4: Add onions, peppers, cabbage, and garlic to skillet and cook over medium heat until vegetables are tender.
directions.5: Add soy sauce and stir until sauce boils.
directions.6: Refrigerate leftovers.

Cafe Mocha.notes: You can substitute 1 cup skim milk for the reconstituted non-fat dried milk.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat reconstituted non-fat dried milk in saucepan until warm; do not boil.
directions.3: Add coffee and hot chocolate mix. Stir well and heat to desired temperature.
directions.4: Divide coffee mixture between two mugs. Top with non-fat whipped topping and cinnamon, if desired.

ingredients: 3/4 teaspoon lemon pepper seasoning, no salt added
1 pound catfish fillets, frozen, thawed, drained
Cajun Catfish.notes: This recipe contains one or more ingredients considered to be traditional or indigenous to Native American communities in certain regions across North America.

directions.1: Preheat oven to 400°F. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray.
directions.2: Combine cornmeal and spices in a shallow dish.
directions.3: Dip each fillet in the cornmeal mixture. Coat evenly.
directions.4: Place fillets on a baking sheet.
directions.5: Bake 20–25 minutes flipping catfish halfway through. Catfish should reach a final internal cook temperature of 145 F as measured with a food thermometer before serving.

ingredients: 1 ripe avocado (seeded, peeled, and cut into chunks)
California Avocado Super Summer Wrap.notes:
Learn more about:

Avocados
Limes
Blueberries
Carrots
Onions
Herbs

directions.1: Mash half the avocado chunks with yogurt and lime juice in a medium bowl.
directions.2: Add remaining filling ingredients, including the rest of the avocado chunks; mix gently.
directions.3: Top each tortilla with 1/4 of filling mixture.
directions.4: Roll tuck in ends. Slice in half diagonally, securing with toothpicks, if needed.

Candied Yams.notes:
Learn more about:

Sweet Potatoes and Yams
Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Cut yams in half and boil until tender, but firm (about 20 minutes). When cool enough to handle, peel and slice into 1/4 inch thickness.
directions.4: Combine sugar, flour, salt, cinnamon, nutmeg, and grated orange peel.
directions.5: Place half of sliced yams in medium-sized casserole dish. Sprinkle with spiced sugar mixture.
directions.6: Dot with half the amount of margarine.
directions.7: Add second layer of yams, using the rest of the ingredients in the order above. Add orange juice.
directions.8: Bake uncovered for 20 minutes.

Cantaloupe Cooler.notes:
For a new twist, try other melons or strawberries in place of the cantaloupe.
Learn more about:

Cantaloupe
Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cut melon in half. Scoop out seeds, remove rind, and discard. Cut melon into 1-inch cubes.
directions.3: In blender or food processor, blend melon cubes with 1/2 cup orange juice until smooth.
directions.4: Pour purée into pitcher and stir in the remaining orange juice and the sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved.
directions.5: Pour into glasses filled with crushed ice.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Reconstitute non-fat dried milk with water. Combine reconstituted milk and cornstarch in a small saucepan and mix until cornstarch in thoroughly dissolved.
directions.3: Add the butter and brown sugar and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly with a wire whisk until mixture thickens and comes to a boil. Continue to boil 1 minute.
directions.4: Remove pan from heat and stir in vanilla. Serve warm over baked French toast, ice cream, or fruit.

ingredients: 1 cup black beans, low-sodium (canned, drained and rinsed)
Caribbean Bean Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Lettuce
Onions
Oranges
Tomatoes
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Toss all ingredients together in large salad bowl.
directions.3: Serve immediately or refrigerate up to one hour.

ingredients: 1 can (15.5 ounces) black beans, low sodium (or beans of your choice)
Caribbean Casserole.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Tomatoes
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Sauté onion and green pepper in canola oil, in a large pan, until tender. Do not brown.
directions.3: Add tomatoes, beans (include liquid from both), oregano, and garlic powder. Bring to a boil.
directions.4: Stir in rice and cover.
directions.5: Reduce heat to simmer for 5 minutes.
directions.6: Remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.

Caribbean Pink Beans.notes:
Learn more about:

Tomatoes
Bell Peppers
Onions
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Rinse and pick through the beans. Put the beans in a large pot and add 10 cups of water. Place the pot in the refrigerator and allow the beans to soak overnight.
directions.3: Cook the beans until they are soft. Add more water as needed while the beans are cooking.
directions.4: Add the plantains, tomato, pepper, onion, garlic, and salt. Continue cooking at low heat until the plantains are soft.

Carrot Cookies.notes:
Instead of honey, you can use 1 1/4 cups sugar mixed with 1/4 cup water.
Learn more about:

Carrots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large bowl, cream together margarine and honey. Stir in carrots and egg whites.
directions.3: Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, oatmeal and raisins. Gradually stir flour-oatmeal mixture into creamed mixture, just until all flour is mixed. Do not over mix.
directions.4: Drop from teaspoon on greased baking sheet. Flatten slightly and bake at 350 °F for 10 minutes, or until lightly browned.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a medium bowl, thoroughly mix carrots, raisins, sugar, and lemon juice.
directions.3: Serve chilled.

ingredients: 1/2 cup tomato juice, low-sodium (from a can)
2 tablespoons fresh parsley (chopped, or 1 teaspoon dried)
Carrots with Tomatoes and Macaroni.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Tomatoes
Carrots
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a saucepan, cook the onion in the oil until soft but not brown. Add the tomatoes, carrots, salt, pepper, and sugar.
directions.3: Cover and cook over low heat for 5 minutes. Remove the cover and cook over low heat, stirring often, for another 5 minutes, or until the carrots are tender and the tomatoes are cooked down to a sauce.
directions.4: Stir in the parsley. Mix the butter with the cooked elbows. Stir in the carrot mixture and serve.

Catfish Stew and Rice.notes:
Learn more about:

Tomatoes
Cabbage
Garlic
Potatoes
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel potatoes and cut into quarters.
directions.3: In large pot, combine potatoes, tomatoes and their juice, onion, water, and garlic. Bring to boil and reduce heat. Cook covered over medium-low heat for 10 minutes.
directions.4: Add cabbage and return to boil. Reduce heat. Cook covered over medium-low heat for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
directions.5: Meanwhile, cut fillets into 2-inch lengths. Coat with Chili and Spice Seasoning.
directions.6: Add fish to vegetables. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 5 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork.
directions.7: Serve in soup plates. Garnish with sliced green onion, if desired. Serve with scoop of hot cooked rice.

Cauliflower Shells with Cheese.notes:
Low-fat cheddar cheese used in nutrition analysis.
Learn more about:

Cauliflower

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Fill 1 pot with 6 cups of water and bring to a boil. Once the water is boiling, add pasta and cook for 8 minutes.
directions.3: Drain pasta and fill the same pot with 2 cups of water, bring to a boil.
directions.4: Place the chopped cauliflower in the boiling water and cook until the florets are soft (about 4 minutes). Drain cauliflower.
directions.5: Placed the cooked cauliflower, 1/2 cup milk, and garlic salt in a blender and blend until smooth.
directions.6: In a separate pot, heat oil. Add the flour and whisk until the mixture is smooth. Add 1 cup of milk and cook the mixture until it bubbles and thickens. Add the cheese and cauliflower and mix.
directions.7: Once the mixture is complete, remove from heat. Add the pasta back into the sauce and serve.

Celery with Apricot Blue Cheese Spread.notes:
Tips on how to select, store, and serve celery:

Choose straight, rigid celery stalks with fresh leaves. Avoid pithy, woody, or limp stalks.
Refrigerate in a plastic bag for a week or more.
Add chopped celery stalks and celery leaves to your soups, stews, and casseroles for extra nutrition, flavor, and crunch.
Add diced celery to your favorite tuna, chicken, egg, or vegetable salad recipe for extra texture.
Cut-up celery for a flavorful addition to healthy stir-fry dishes.

Learn more about:

Apricots
Celery

directions.1: Chop dried fruit and pecans.
directions.2: Mix blue cheese, cream cheese, and yogurt with a fork or hand mixer until smooth.
directions.3: Stir in chopped, dried fruit and pecans. Refrigerate spread until ready for use.
directions.4: Slice celery stalks into 3-4 inch sticks.
directions.5: Fill celery pieces with spread.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place the flour in a large mixing bowl. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix with fork and then with hands. Keep mixing until you can make a ball.
directions.3: Knead the dough for about 10 minutes. Let rest for 30 minutes in the bowl, covered with a damp cloth.
directions.4: Roll the ball into a 12-inch log and cut into 6 chunks.
directions.5: Roll each chunk into a very thin pancake, about 7 inches in diameter. Don't worry about making the dough into a perfect circle-just try to get it as thin as you can.
directions.6: Heat a cast iron skillet (lightly greased) on medium-high heat. Place one chapati in the skillet and cook for 30 seconds.
directions.7: Use a spatula to lift bread. When chapati gets brown spots and bubbles, flip it over and cook for another 30 seconds.
directions.8: Wrap the cooked chapati in a cloth napkin while cooking the rest.
directions.9: Eat them right away with a little butter or margarine, or use as scoops for eating other dishes.

Cheese and Corn Chowder.notes:
To make a Ham, Cheese, and Corn Chowder: Add 1/2 cup cubed, cooked ham.
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Carrots
Celery
Onions
Corn

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine potatoes, carrots, celery, onion and seasonings in pan. Add 1 cup water. Cover and simmer 10 minutes.
directions.3: Add corn and pepper. Cook 5 more minutes or until vegetables are cooked.
directions.4: Add milk and cheese. Stir until cheese melts and chowder is heated through. Do not boil.
directions.5: Serve hot.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Scrub the potatoes.
directions.4: Put the potatoes in the oven. Bake 30 to 40 minutes until tender.
directions.5: Slice each potato in half lengthwise.
directions.6: Use a spoon to scoop out the inside of each potato. Leave about 1/2 inch of potato next to the skin. Save the inside part of each potato in a small bowl.
directions.7: Peel the onion. Chop it to make 2 tablespoons chopped onion.
directions.8: Put the cheese, milk, and onion in another small bowl. Add the insides of the potatoes. Mix with a fork until light and fluffy.
directions.9: Divide this mix into 8 parts. Put part of the mix inside each potato.
directions.10: Sprinkle paprika over the potatoes.
directions.11: Return to the oven for 5 minutes to reheat.

ingredients: 1 jar (24 oz) spaghetti sauce, meatless, low-sodium

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a bowl combine sauce and water.
directions.3: In another bowl combine cottage cheese, egg and oregano.
directions.4: Grease 1 quart casserole.
directions.5: Spoon in 1/3 sauce.
directions.6: Top with 1 cup macaroni, 1/2 cottage cheese, 1/2 mozzarella cheese and 1/3 of the spaghetti sauce.
directions.7: Repeat layers.
directions.8: Cover with aluminum foil.
directions.9: Bake in a 350 °F oven for 45 minutes.
directions.10: Uncover and bake 15 minutes longer.

Cheesy Broccoli & Rice Squares.notes:
Learn more about:

Broccoli
Herbs
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F and coat a 9x9 inch baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
directions.3: In a bowl, combine the brown rice, cheese, onion, broccoli, parsley, and salt.
directions.4: In a separate bowl, combine the eggs, Worcestershire sauce, and evaporated milk. Pour over rice mixture. Mix well.
directions.5: Pour into the 9x9-inch baking dish.
directions.6: Bake until just firm, about 35 to 40 minutes. Cut into squares to serve.

ingredients: 1 can (10.75 oz) cream of mushroom soup, reduced-sodium (condensed)
Cheesy Chicken, Broccoli, and Rice Bake.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Broccoli

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F. In large saucepan, bring water to boil. Add rice, onion, and garlic. Cook for about 30 minutes or until rice is soft.
directions.3: While rice is cooking combine milk, soup, salt, and pepper, mix well. When rice is done combine with milk mixture, chicken, and broccoli. Mix well.
directions.4: Grease 9x13 pan and pour mixture into pan. Bake in preheated oven for 18 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for another 6 minutes or until cheese is melted.
directions.5: Serve immediately.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cut the beef roast into 4 pieces.
directions.3: In a small bowl, mix the flour and salt.
directions.4: Dip each piece of meat into the mix of flour and salt. Coat it on all sides with the mix.
directions.5: Put the meat in the crock pot.
directions.6: Add the chopped carrots and onion.
directions.7: Add the Worcestershire sauce and tomato sauce.
directions.8: Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours, OR on high for 4-5 hours.
directions.9: Just before serving, sprinkle the cheese on top.

ingredients: 1 can pineapple chunks, 20 ounces (in juice, not drained)
2 cans mandarin oranges, 11 ounces (in light syrup, drained)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Pour boiling water into a large bowl. Add the gelatin and cinnamon to boiling water. Stir for at least 2 minutes until gelatin is completely dissolved.
directions.3: Drain pineapple, reserving the juice. Add enough ice (or cold water) to the juice to measure 1 1/2 cups. Add the gelatin mixture and stir until the ice is completely melted.
directions.4: Refrigerate for about 45 minutes or until the gelatin is slightly thickened (consistency of unbeaten egg white).
directions.5: Reserve 1/4 cup each of the pineapple and orange. Add remaining pineapple and oranges to the gelatin. Pour into 1 1/2 quart serving bowl.
directions.6: Refrigerate for 4 hours or until firm. Garnish with reserved pineapple and oranges.

ingredients: 2 cups halved, pitted sweet cherries, fresh or frozen, thawed and drained
Cherry Puff Pancake.notes:
Try using other fruit, such as peaches, pears, or blueberries.
Serve with plain or vanilla yogurt.

Learn more about

Cherries

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 450 °F.
directions.3: In a medium bowl or blender, beat the eggs, milk, and vanilla together until well blended.
directions.4: Mix the flour, sugar, and cinnamon together. Add to the liquid ingredients and mix until there are no lumps.
directions.5: Put margarine or butter in a 10- or 11-inch oven proof skillet or a 2 1/2- to 3-quart baking dish. Place the skillet or dish in the hot oven until the margarine or butter is melted and bubbly. Remove from the oven. Quickly spread the cherries across the bottom of the hot skillet or dish.
directions.6: Pour the batter over the cherries and sprinkle with almond slices, if using.
directions.7: Return to the oven and bake for 15 to 20 minutes until the edges are browned and the puffs in the middle are golden. Cool slightly before cutting into 4 pieces. The center puffs will flatten during cooling.

ingredients: 1/2 cup pitted and halved sweet cherries
Cherry Salad.notes:
Try using different types of melon or grapes.
Learn more about:

Cherries
Cantaloupe
Grapes
Bananas
Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large bowl, mix together the cut fruit.
directions.3: Pour orange juice over fruit and stir in coconut, if desired.

Chicken and Beans.notes:
Cider, white, and Japanese wine vinegars differ in flavor. Try other vegetables. Dry beans may be used. See package for cooking directions.
Learn more about:

Garlic
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain and rinse beans.
directions.3: Crush garlic.
directions.4: Dice onion.
directions.5: Dice chicken thighs.
directions.6: In large, pot, cook chicken until half done.
directions.7: Add tomato sauce, vinegar, onion, garlic, sugar, salt, and pepper.
directions.8: Simmer for about 30 to 40 minutes or until chicken is tender.
directions.9: Add kidney beans and simmer for 5-10 more minutes.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook rice in 2 cups of water.
directions.3: Let broccoli thaw.
directions.4: Chicken should be off the bone.
directions.5: Melt margarine in large sauce pan. Add flour to melted margarine and stir. This will be lumpy.
directions.6: Use broth from chicken you cooked or use canned chicken broth. Slowly add broth to margarine/flour. Stir to remove lumps and thicken.
directions.7: Add cheese and stir.
directions.8: Add rice, broccoli, and chicken. Stir.
directions.9: Put in a casserole pan and bake at 350 °F for 30 minutes or until thoroughly heated.

ingredients: 12 ounces chicken, cooked and diced (1 1/2 cups)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Toss chicken, cranberries, and almonds with dressing.
directions.3: Serve on a mound of chopped lettuce.

ingredients: 1 cup celery, chopped, including some leaves
8 cups chicken broth, fat free, reduced sodium
2 cups fresh spinach leaves, coarsely chopped
Chicken and Dumpling Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Carrots
Onions
Celery
Herbs
Spinach

directions.1: Heat oil in Dutch oven or soup kettle over medium-high heat.
directions.2: Sauté carrot, onion and celery for 5 minutes; stir in broth, chicken, peppercorns, thyme, and bay leaves.
directions.3: Reduce heat to low; simmer, partially covered for 20 minutes.
directions.4: Meanwhile, in small bowl, mix dumpling ingredients until well blended.
directions.5: Drop small spoonsful of dumpling dough into simmering soup.
directions.6: Cover soup and allow dumplings to cook for about 20 minutes (they will rise to the top of the soup as they cook).
directions.7: Stir in spinach.
directions.8: Remove bay leaves before serving soup.

ingredients: 5 cups brown rice (cooked in unsalted water)
3 1/2 cups chicken breast (cooked, skin and bone removed, diced)
Chicken and Spanish Rice.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Herbs
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large skillet, sauté onions and green peppers in oil for 5 minutes on medium heat.
directions.3: Add tomato sauce and spices. Heat through.
directions.4: Add cooked rice and chicken. Heat through.

Chicken Apple Salad Sandwich.notes:
May substitute approximately 3 tablespoons of lemon juice for 1 fresh lemon, juiced.
Suggest serving sandwiches with lettuce and tomato.

Learn more about:

Celery
Apples
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients except for bread together in a bowl.
directions.3: Create 4 sandwiches on whole wheat bread.

ingredients: 1/8 recipe for Basic Soup and Sauce Mix (1/3 cup dry recipe)
Chicken Broccoli Alfredo.notes:
Recipe for Basic Soup and Sauce Mix. 1 serving = 1/3 cup.

Learn more about:

Broccoli

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Add broccoli for the last 4 minutes of cooking time. Drain.
directions.3: Heat butter in skillet. Add chicken and cook until browned, stirring often.
directions.4: Combine sauce mix and water in saucepan. Bring to a boil and cook until thick. Add milk, cheese, pepper, and fettuccine mixture and heat through.
directions.5: Serve with additional Parmesan cheese.

ingredients: 4 chicken pieces, skin removed (thighs, breasts, or legs)
Chicken Cacciatore.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Tomatoes
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel and chop the onion.
directions.3: Put the chopped onion in a saucepan.
directions.4: Add the tomatoes, tomato sauce, garlic powder, oregano, and pepper.
directions.5: Simmer on low heat for 3 minutes.
directions.6: If needed, remove the chicken skin.
directions.7: Add the chicken to the sauce pan and cover.
directions.8: Cook over low heat for about 1 hour until the chicken is tender.

ingredients: 1 pound rotini or macaroni pasta (1 package)
1/2 can low-sodium green peas, drained (about 8 ounces)

directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.2: Cook rotini or macaroni according to package directions. Drain well.
directions.3: In a large oven-safe dish, mix the chicken, tomato sauce, peas, and macaroni.
directions.4: Add the 3 slices of cheese on top of the casserole.
directions.5: Bake for 30 to 40 minutes.
directions.6: Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 cup pasta (uncooked whole wheat, small, such as macaroni or rotelle)
6 cups Romaine lettuce (well washed and torn, or spinach)
2 cups green peppers, fresh, chopped (or choose a combination of bell peppers, celery, cauliflower florets, cucumber, carrots*)
1 1/2 cups cubed cooked skinless chicken (1/2 pound skinless, boneless chicken)
Chicken Club Salad.notes:
*2 cups of green bell peppers were used for cost analysis and nutrition calculations.
Learn more about:

Lettuce
Bell Peppers
Celery
Cauliflower
Cucumber
Carrots
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook pasta according to package directions; drain and cool.
directions.3: Place 1 1/2 cups of the Romaine lettuce in each of 4 large bowls or plates.
directions.4: Combine chopped vegetables, chicken, and pasta.
directions.5: Add dressing; toss lightly to coat. Divide evenly among the 4 bowls.
directions.6: Top each serving with a few egg slices, if desired, and 1 tablespoon of the shredded cheese.

ingredients: 1 chicken (fryer, cut into pieces, skin and fat removed)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place chicken in a large pot with the 1/4 cup of water. Cover and simmer until tender, about 45 minutes.
directions.3: In a medium bowl, mix chili powder, oregano, cocoa, flour (1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons), pepper, and garlic powder along with 1 cup of water.
directions.4: Add mixture from step 2 to chicken in pot; mix well.
directions.5: Add peanut butter and 5 cups of water to chicken in pot; mix well.
directions.6: Bring to a boil.
directions.7: Reduce heat to medium. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes.
directions.8: Stir and serve immediately.

Chicken Noodle Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Celery
Carrots
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Thaw frozen chicken in refrigerator (about 24 hours), or thaw in microwave just before cooking soup.
directions.3: Place chicken pieces in large kettle. Cover completely with water. Cover, bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer 2 to 3 hours.
directions.4: With soap and water, carefully wash your hands and any counter surfaces and equipment that came in contact with raw chicken.
directions.5: Remove cooked chicken pieces from broth with tongs or slotted spoon. Cool 10 to 15 minutes before separating bones from meat. Break meat into bite-sized pieces. Remove any bones from broth.
directions.6: Remove fat from broth by skimming with spoon, adding and removing ice cubes, or blotting top of broth with paper towels.
directions.7: Put chicken meat, seasonings and vegetables into stock.
directions.8: Bring broth to a boil, cover, reduce heat and cook about 15 to 20 minutes on medium heat until sliced carrots are crispy-tender.
directions.9: Add noodles and boil uncovered for about 6 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally to break up any noodles that might stick together. (One cup of dry noodles [1 1/2 ounce] makes one cup of cooked noodles).
directions.10: Ladle into soup bowls.
directions.11: Refrigerate or freeze leftovers within 2 hours of cooking. If refrigerated, use within 2 days. When reheating, bring to a boil.

ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) black beans, low sodium (rinsed and drained)
Chicken Pasta Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Bell Peppers
Onions
Summer Squash
Corn
Peas

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook pasta according to package directions, drain; rinse.
directions.3: Combine first eight ingredients (pasta through black beans) in a large bowl.
directions.4: Toss gently with salad dressing.
directions.5: Chill for several hours to blend flavors.

ingredients: 1 teaspoon cayenne or jalapeño chilies, seeds removed and finely chopped (optional)
Chicken Posole.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Carrots
Celery
Garlic
Herbs

directions.1: In a medium-sized pot, brown onion, carrots, celery, and garlic in vegetable oil over medium heat for 10 minutes.
directions.2: Add hominy, chicken, and water. If using cayenne pepper, jalapeño chilies, chili powder, or oregano, add that, too. Mix well.
directions.3: Bring pot to a boil. Lower heat and cook for about 10 minutes.
directions.4: Add salt and pepper. Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 chicken (whole, skinned and cut into pieces)
2 cups canned hominy, white or yellow (2 - 15 ounce can, rinsed and drained)
Chicken Pozole Soup.notes:
To make even healthier, use tomato sauce with no added salt.
Learn more about:

Onions
Herbs
Lettuce
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put chicken pieces in a large pot and cover with the 8 cups of water. Simmer over medium heat for 1 hour.
directions.3: Add the chopped onion, pepper, chili powder, tomato sauce, and oregano to simmering chicken.
directions.4: After the chicken is thoroughly cooked take the pieces out of the pot and remove most of the bones from the chicken and the pot.
directions.5: Return chicken to the pot.
directions.6: Add the rinsed hominy to the pot of chicken and simmer for another 45 minutes.
directions.7: Serve with lettuce and a wedge of lime.

ingredients: 2 chicken breast (medium, halved, skinned, fat removed, boned, and cut into 1-inch pieces)
2 zucchini (7 inches long, unpeeled and sliced)
1 eggplant (small, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes)
1 bell pepper (red or green, cut into pieces)
Chicken Ratatouille.notes:
Learn more about:

Zucchini
Eggplant
Onions
Bell Peppers
Mushrooms
Tomatoes
Garlic
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oil in large non-stick skillet. Add chicken and sauté about 3 minutes, or until lightly browned.
directions.3: Add zucchini, eggplant, onion, green pepper, and mushrooms. Cook about 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
directions.4: Add tomatoes, garlic, basil, parsley, and pepper; stir and continue cooking about 5 minutes, or until chicken is tender.

ingredients: Italian herb mix and black pepper to taste (optional)
Chicken Rice Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Lettuce
Tomatoes
Bell Peppers
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Toss all ingredients together in a large salad bowl.
directions.3: Use personal taste preferences to determine the amounts of seasonings.
directions.4: Serve immediately. This salad looks great when served on a large plate with a few of the seasonings sprinkled on top.

ingredients: 1/2 cup canned peach slices (drained and diced)
Chicken Salad and Peach Sandwich.notes:
Learn more about:

Peaches
Celery
Apples
Onions

directions.1: Mix together the chicken, apples, peaches, celery, onion, walnuts, and mayonnaise in a small bowl.
directions.2: Spoon mixture onto 2 slices of the bread.

ingredients: 8 cups cabbage (shredded, or cabbage salad mix)
2 chicken breast (cooked and chilled, cut into cubes)
Chicken Salad with Ramen Noodles.notes:
Learn more about:

Cabbage
Onions
Bell Peppers

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Break up noodles. Set aside.
directions.3: In a small bowl make dressing with sugar, vinegar, olive oil, and flavor packet. Stir well.
directions.4: In a large bowl, add peppers, scallions, unsalted peanuts, and other vegetables if you like. Add cooked chicken and cabbage.
directions.5: Pour on the dressing and combine. Sprinkle noodles on top.
directions.6: Serve cold.

Chicken Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Carrots
Celery
Cabbage
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Use leftover cooked chicken, or cook enough chicken to make 1 cup of chicken pieces.
directions.3: Place the cooked chicken in a large saucepan.
directions.4: Add the broth and uncooked rice. Cover the pan.
directions.5: Bring the broth and rice to a boil.
directions.6: Cover the pan, and turn the heat to low.
directions.7: Stir and simmer for 15 minutes.
directions.8: Add the chopped onions, chopped vegetables, and seasonings.
directions.9: Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes until the vegetables are tender.

ingredients: 1 cup cooked chicken, cubed, or canned (drained)
1/2 cup uncooked rice, macaroni, or small noodles

directions.1: Combine celery, carrots, onions, peas, and chicken broth in a pot. Bring to a boil.
directions.2: Add chicken and reduce heat.
directions.3: Add rice, macaroni, or noodles.
directions.4: Simmer on low until rice, macaroni, or noodles are tender and flavors are mixed. Chicken should reach a final internal cook temperature of 165°F as measured with a food thermometer before serving.

ingredients: 2 cups pinto or garbanzo beans, canned, drained or cooked and drained
Chicken Soup with Chiles.notes:
Learn more about:

Tomatoes
Garlic
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place chicken pieces in a large saucepan and add enough water to cover.
directions.3: Cook until tender, about 25 minutes.
directions.4: Remove chicken pieces from the broth.
directions.5: Add tomatoes, garlic, onion, and chiles.
directions.6: Remove chicken meat from the bones and return meat to broth.
directions.7: Add beans and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for about 15 minutes.

ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken breast, skinless and diced (cooked without salt, about 8 ounces)
1 can tomatoes, diced undrained (14.5 ounces) (low sodium )
1 can cream of chicken soup, low-sodium (10.75 ounces)
1/2 cup cheddar cheese, reduced fat shredded
Chicken Spaghetti.notes:
Learn more about:

Bell Peppers
Onions
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 350 °F. Lightly spray an 8-inch square baking dish with vegetable oil spray.
directions.3: Prepare the spaghetti using the package directions, omitting the salt and oil. Drain well in a colander.
directions.4: Meanwhile, in a large skillet, heat the oil over medium heat, swirling to coat the bottom. Cook the bell peppers and onion for 4 to 5 minutes, or until tender, stirring occasionally.
directions.5: Pour into a large bowl. Stir in the remaining ingredients, including the spaghetti. Pour into a baking dish.
directions.6: Bake, covered, for 20 minutes. Bake, uncovered for 10 minutes, or until the mixture is warmed through and light golden brown on top.

Chicken Spanish Rice.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Green Peppers
Celery
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook onion, green pepper, celery, and rice in vegetable oil at medium heat in a large saucepan until soft, about 5 minutes.
directions.3: Drain tomatoes and save the liquid.
directions.4: Chop tomatoes into small pieces.
directions.5: Add tomatoes, liquid, chicken, water, chili powder, and pepper to rice mixture.
directions.6: Bring to a boil and stir. Cover and cook on low heat. Cook until rice is tender (about 25 minutes).

Chicken Stew.notes:
Learn more about:

Garlic
Onions
Tomatoes
Herbs
Celery
Potatoes
Carrots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Remove the skin from the chicken and any extra fat. In a large skillet combine chicken, water, garlic, onion, salt, pepper, tomatoes, and parsley. Tightly cover and cook over low heat for 25 minutes.
directions.3: Add celery, potatoes, carrots, and bay leaves and continue to cook for 15 minutes or until chicken and vegetables are tender. Remove bay leaves before serving.

ingredients: 1/2 cup carrots, peeled, sliced thinly (or 1/2 can low-sodium carrots, about 8 ounces, drained)
1 pound chicken, cooked, skin removed, sliced into strips
3 cups white rice, cooked (or brown rice)
Chicken Stir-Fry.notes:
Tip for cooking chicken: The recommended safe minimum internal temperature for chicken is 165 °F, as measured by a food thermometer.
Learn more about:

Carrots
Celery
Onions
Bell Peppers
Garlic
Ginger

directions.1: Heat a large pan with vegetable oil over high heat.
directions.2: Add vegetables and garlic to the hot pan. Stir until garlic is slightly brown. If using ginger, add that too.
directions.3: Add the chicken and sugar to the pan. If using soy sauce, add that too.
directions.4: Stir the food for about 1 minute in the pan.
directions.5: Serve with cooked rice.

ingredients: 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup (reduced sodium)
4 ounces chopped green chiles, canned (1 can)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix mushroom soup, milk, chicken, and green chile peppers.
directions.3: Pour 1/3 of the soup mixture into the bottom of a 2-quart baking dish that has been coated with oil or cooking spray
directions.4: Layer half the tortilla strips.
directions.5: Spread 1/3 of the soup mixture on top of the tortillas.
directions.6: Sprinkle on half the cheese.
directions.7: Repeat layers of tortilla strips and soup mix and end with cheese.
directions.8: Baked at 350 °F for 1 hour.

ingredients: 1 cup chicken, cooked, skinned and cubed
1/2 cup brown rice, cooked (or white rice)
1 cup kale (chopped, about one large leaf)
Chicken Vegetable Soup with Kale.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Carrots
Herbs
Garlic
Tomatoes
Kale

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oil in a medium sauce pan. Add onion and carrots. Sauté until vegetables are tender, about 5 to 8 minutes.
directions.3: Add thyme and garlic. Sauté for one more minute.
directions.4: Add water or broth, tomatoes, cooked rice, chicken, and kale.
directions.5: Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes.

ingredients: 1/3 cup nonfat or low-fat plain yogurt
1 cup red or green grapes, halved
1/2 cup chopped walnuts, divided (toasted if desired)
Chicken Waldorf Salad.notes:
Quick Tip: If you want cooked chicken in a hurry, the easiest way to cook it is to poach it (one pound of raw boneless, skinless chicken breasts yields about 2 1/2 cups chopped or shredded cooked chicken).
Place boneless, skinless chicken breasts in a skillet or saucepan.
Add lightly salted water (or chicken broth) to cover and bring to a boil.
Cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer gently until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the middle (approximately 10 to 15 minutes).

Learn more about:

Apples
Grapes
Celery

directions.1: Whisk mayonnaise, yogurt, lemon juice and salt in a large bowl.
directions.2: Add chicken, apple, grapes, celery, and half of the walnuts. Stir to coat well.
directions.3: Serve topped with the remaining walnuts.

ingredients: 2 teaspoons parsley, dried (or 2 Tablespoons fresh, finely chopped)
1 cup apple or cantaloupe (cut into chunks)
1/3 cup grape halves (red or purple, cut into chunks)
1 1/4 cups chicken, cooked (cut into bite-size pieces)
Chicken, Rice, and Fruit Salad.notes:
A child could wash the fruit and help remove the seeds.
Note: Recipe analysis was done using brown rice.

Learn more about:

Herbs
Garlic
Apples
Grapes
Cantaloupe
Celery
Lettuce

directions.1: Wash your hands with soap and water.
directions.2: If not using leftover or "planned over" rice, cook rice according to package directions without adding salt. Chill.
directions.3: In a serving bowl, mix parsley, black pepper, garlic, dressing, and mayonnaise together.
directions.4: Add cooled rice, apple, grapes, celery, and chicken. Stir gently.
directions.5: Serve cold on a bed of clean lettuce leaves, if desired.
directions.6: Cover and refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

ingredients: 1 can (19 oz) chickpeas, low-sodium (drained garbanzo beans)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put all ingredients into a food processor and blend until smooth.
directions.3: Serve at room temperature with pita chips, crackers, carrots, or other dipping vegetables.

ingredients: 1 can (14.5 oz) low-sodium diced tomatoes (including liquid)
1 can (16 oz) low-sodium chickpeas (drained and rinsed with cold water)
1 package (10 oz) frozen spinach (kale can be used instead of spinach)
1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice (or red vinegar)
Chickpeas and Spinach Saut\u00e9.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Celery
Carrots
Tomatoes
Spinach
Lemons

directions.1: Put a skillet on the stove on medium high heat. When the skillet is hot, add oil.
directions.2: Add onion, garlic, celery and carrot and cook about 15 minutes until the mixture is soft and the onions are lightly browned.
directions.3: Raise the heat to high and add the tomatoes, beans (white beans instead of chickpeas) and water and cook for 5 minutes. Lower the heat to low and top the mixture with the spinach (don’t worry about stirring). Cover and cook until the spinach has thawed and heated throughout, about 10 minutes. Stir well.
directions.4: Add the lemon juice and red pepper flakes and stir thoroughly.
directions.5: Serve with cooked quinoa or brown rice.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix together all ingredients.
directions.3: Store in airtight container.

ingredients: 1 can (15.5 ounces) pinto beans, low-sodium (or 2 cups cooked dried beans)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mash beans in a bowl.
directions.3: Add onion and chili powder and shredded cheese.
directions.4: Serve warm or cold with raw vegetables or tortilla chips.

ingredients: 31 ounces can white or yellow hominy, drained and rinsed (2 - 15.5 ounce cans)
2 cans (4 oz each) chopped green chiles, drained
Chili Cheese Hominy.notes:
Try with different types of grated or crumbled cheese.
Learn more about:

Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat (350 °F in an electric skillet). Add onion and cook until tender, about 2 to 3 minutes.
directions.3: Stir in hominy, green chiles, sour cream, chili powder and pepper. Add half of the cheese and mix well.
directions.4: Reduce heat to medium (300 °F in an electric skillet). Cover and cook until heated through, about 3 to 5 minutes.
directions.5: Sprinkle remaining cheese on top. Cover and cook until cheese melts, about 5 minutes.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix popcorn and margarine in a bowl.
directions.3: Mix seasonings thoroughly and sprinkle over popcorn. Mix well.
directions.4: Serve immediately and enjoy with family and friends.

ingredients: 1 can diced tomatoes, low-sodium (14.5 ounces, undrained)
2 servings Eating Smart Seasoning Mix (1/2 cup)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Brown ground beef in a large skillet, drain the fat.
directions.3: Add water, macaroni, tomatoes, chili powder, and seasoning mix. Stir.
directions.4: Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and simmer covered on low heat for 20 minutes or until macaroni is tender.
directions.5: Taste, and add a small amount of salt if desired.
directions.6: Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Put the lid back on for 1 minute until the cheese is melted.

Chilled Blueberry Soup.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with grilled salmon fish fillet (about 3 to 4 ounces), asparagus, and water with lemon slice.
Learn more about:

Blueberries
Herbs

directions.1: Rinse blueberries and set aside a few for garnishing.
directions.2: Blend all ingredients in food processor or blender.
directions.3: Serve immediately.
directions.4: Garnish with mint leaves and blueberries, if desired.

Chilled Cantaloupe Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Cantaloupe
Oranges
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place cantaloupe and 1/2 cup orange juice in a container of a blender or food processor.
directions.3: Cover with lid and blend until smooth. Transfer to large bowl.
directions.4: Stir in lime juice, cinnamon, and remaining orange juice.
directions.5: Cover, and refrigerate for at least one hour.
directions.6: Serve chilled.

ingredients: 1/2 cup chocolate chips (miniature, or carob chips)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oven to 375 °F.
directions.3: In a large bowl combine sugar, brown sugar and margarine; beat until light and fluffy.
directions.4: Add yogurt and vanilla; blend well. Stir in flour and baking soda; mix well. Stir in chocolate chips.
directions.5: Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto un-greased cookie sheets. Bake at 375 °F for 8 to 12 minutes or until light and golden brown.
directions.6: Cool 1 minute, remove from cookie sheets.

ingredients: 2 packages low calorie chocolate pudding (1.4 ounces each, instant or cook and serve type)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix pudding according to package directions, except use 3 1/2 cups milk. Beat in peanut butter.
directions.3: Line a 9x13 inch pan with half the graham crackers.
directions.4: Spread pudding mixture over graham crackers. Top with remaining crackers.
directions.5: Freeze for four hours.
directions.6: Cut into squares and remove from pan.
directions.7: Store in a plastic bag in the freezer.

Chunky Garbanzo Bean Dip.notes:
Suggest serving with vegetables like carrots, pea pods, and celery.
Learn more about:

Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain and rinse the beans and mash in a small bowl with a fork or potato masher until most of the beans have been crushed. If you have a food processor, you can use it for this step.
directions.3: Stir in oil and onion along with lemon pepper and salt to taste. The mixture will be chunky, not smooth.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Rinse the raisins and almonds with water.
directions.3: Toss them in the food processor with the cinnamon. When sufficiently mixed, form into balls or bar shapes.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F. Spray 12 muffin cups with cooking spray.
directions.3: Combine 2 tablespoons sugar and 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon in a small bowl; set aside.
directions.4: In a large bowl, combine cereal and milk and set aside for 5 minutes.
directions.5: Combine 6 tablespoons sugar, 1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon, flour, baking powder, and baking soda in a bowl. Whisk pumpkin, egg, and vanilla into cereal.
directions.6: Fold in dry mixture; being careful not to over mix. Spoon into prepared pan and sprinkle with pecans and sugar-cinnamon mixture.
directions.7: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Cinnamon Vanilla Granola.notes: * Children under the age of one should not consume honey.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 275 °F.
directions.3: Mix honey, water, vegetable oil, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl.
directions.4: Stir in oats; mix well.
directions.5: Spread mixture on a cookie sheet, making a thin layer.
directions.6: Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from oven, stir mixture well and return to oven.
directions.7: Bake 20 minutes more and stir as before.
directions.8: Bake 5 to 20 minutes more, until granola is golden brown.
directions.9: Break into small pieces with spatula.
directions.10: Cool and then store in a covered container.

directions.1: In small bowl, mix sugar and cinnamon; set aside.
directions.2: In large microwavable bowl, microwave butter uncovered on HIGH about 40 seconds, or until melted.
directions.3: Stir in cereals until evenly coated. Microwave uncovered 2 minutes, stirring after 1 minute.
directions.4: Sprinkle half of the sugar mixture evenly over cereals; stir. Sprinkle with remaining sugar mixture; stir.
directions.5: Microwave uncovered 1 minute.
directions.6: Stir in raisins or dried cranberries. Spread on paper towels to cool.

Citrus Chicken.notes:
Orange or lemon juice can be used instead of lime juice.
Garnish with orange slices or lime wedges.

Learn more about:

Herbs
Limes
Oranges

directions.1: Preheat the oven to 425 °F.
directions.2: To trim the chicken, lay the chicken thighs on the cutting board, skin side up. Press down on the chicken to push out the excess fat. Use a sharp knife to cut excess fat.
directions.3: Put the chicken, oregano, cumin, lime juice, salt, and pepper in the bowl and mix well. Proceed to the next step or cover and refrigerate up to overnight.
directions.4: Put the contents of the bowl in the baking pan and transfer to the oven.
directions.5: Bake about 1 hour until cooked throughout and well browned.
directions.6: Serve right away.

Citrus Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Grapefruits
Oranges
Lettuce
Onions
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cut fruit into bite size pieces.
directions.3: Toss with lettuce and onion. Mix remaining ingredients for dressing. Drizzle over salad and toss just before serving.

ingredients: 1 orange or lemon, cut into wedges (optional)
Citrus Salmon Fillets.notes: This recipe contains one or more ingredients considered to be traditional or indigenous to Native American communities in certain regions across North America.

directions.1: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.
directions.2: In an oven safe skillet, heat oil on medium high heat.
directions.3: Add onion, carrots (or sweet potato), parsley, and ½ cup of orange juice. Cook 5-8 minutes.
directions.4: In a small bowl, mix ½ cup orange juice and honey.
directions.5: In center of skillet, add salmon fillets and season with salt and pepper.
directions.6: Pour orange juice and honey mixture over top.
directions.7: Bake entire skillet in oven 16-18 minutes or until fish is flaky.
directions.8: Garnish with orange or lemon wedges, if using

ingredients: 1/4 cup tomatoes, diced (or 2 tablespoons, about 2 ounces, low-sodium diced tomatoes, drained)
6 slices whole grain bread (or homemade bread)
1/4 cup fresh parsley or cilantro, chopped (optional)
1 tablespoon cayenne or jalapeño chilies, diced (optional)
3 slices pasteurized process American cheese, cut into halves
Citrus Tuna Melt.notes:
Learn more about:

Limes
Lemons
Onions
Tomatoes
Apples
Celery
Herbs
Lettuce

directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.2: In a medium-sized bowl, combine tuna, lime juice, onion, tomatoes, apple, celery, and pepper. Mix well.
directions.3: Toast the bread.
directions.4: Place 6 slices of toasted bread on a cookie sheet. Put an even amount of tuna mixture on top of each slice. If using parsley and chilies, add these too.
directions.5: Put 1/2 slice cheese on top of the tuna and bake for about 3 minutes.
directions.6: Add an extra slice of tomato and lettuce on top if you like.
directions.7: Serve hot.

ingredients: 4 cups mixed vegetables, sliced and steamed (such as zucchini, corn, and tomatoes)
Citrus Vegetables.notes:
Learn more about:

Limes
Oregano
Zucchini
Corn
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Slice vegetables and steam in a small amount of water.
directions.3: Drain, and place in a bowl to cool.
directions.4: Mix lime juice with oil. Add oregano and combine.
directions.5: Pour lime juice mixture over cool vegetables and mix well.
directions.6: Serve.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 325 °F.
directions.3: Place saucepan with water on stove over medium-high heat and allow to come to a boil.
directions.4: Spray four ovenproof custard cups with vegetable oil spray.
directions.5: Combine the whole egg, egg substitute, milk, 1/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon of honey, grated lemon zest, and vanilla. Beat until mixed but not foamy.
directions.6: In a separate bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of honey and cinnamon, and mix to blend.
directions.7: Place the custard cups in a baking dish large enough to accommodate them, plus the water bath. Spoon 1/2 tablespoon of honey and cinnamon into each custard cup. Divide the egg mixture equally into each custard cup.
directions.8: Place the baking dish on the rack in the middle of the oven and pour the boiling water into the baking dish to a depth of 1 inch, taking care not to let the water splash the flan. Bake for 45 minutes or until the knife blade comes out clean when inserted.
directions.9: Serve warm or cold. Before serving, loosen the edges with a knife or spatula and invert onto individual dessert plates.

ingredients: 1 1/4 cups cheese, finely shredded sharp cheddar, lowfat

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook macaroni according to directions. (Do not add salt to the cooking water.) Drain and set aside.
directions.3: Spray a casserole dish with nonstick cooking oil spray.
directions.4: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.5: Lightly spray saucepan with nonstick cooking oil spray.
directions.6: Add onions to saucepan and sauté for about 3 minutes.
directions.7: In another bowl, combine macaroni, onions, and the remaining ingredients and mix thoroughly.
directions.8: Transfer mixture into casserole dish.
directions.9: Bake for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

directions.1: For the dressing, mix pear juice, vinegar, honey, mustard, and salt and pepper and olive oil in a blender.
directions.2: Put mixed greens in large mixing bowl, drizzle dressing over greens and mix together.
directions.3: Add remaining chopped pear, walnuts, and grated carrots and toss lightly.
directions.4: Portion out 1 cup of salad and top with 1/2 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese.

ingredients: 1/2 cup of coffee (1/2 cup or 4 fluid ounces - cooled to room temperature)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a blender, combine all ingredients; purée until smooth.
directions.3: Pour into a chilled glass and sprinkle with cinnamon, cocoa, or nutmeg if you like.

Collard Green Gumbo with Ham Hock.notes:
One medium sized chicken sausage link can be substituted for a ham hock.
Learn more about:

Onions
Celery
Garlic
Herbs
Collard Greens

directions.1: Put a skillet on the stove and turn the heat to medium. When it is hot, add the oil. Add the onion, bell pepper, celery, garlic, thyme, red pepper flakes, salt, and oregano, and cook until golden, about 20 minutes.
directions.2: Add the flour in small amounts, sprinkling a little bit at a time and stirring well, until it turns slightly brown, about 10 minutes.
directions.3: Slowly add the water, stirring constantly. Add the ham hock. Raise the heat to high and when it comes to a boil reduce heat to low.
directions.4: Add the collard greens and cook until tender, about 45 minutes.
directions.5: Divide the brown rice between 4 shallow bowls and top each with about 1 cup of gumbo.

ingredients: 2 cups spinach leaves (fresh, or 9 oz. frozen, thawed and squeezed dry)
Colorful Quesadillas.notes:
Learn more about:

Bell Peppers
Spinach

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.

Cooked Beans.notes:
To avoid broken or mushy beans, boil gently and stir very little.
Taste-test beans often for desired tenderness.
Foods containing acid such as tomatoes, chili sauce, lemon juice, vinegar, or catsup will slow the cooking and softening of the beans. Add these items last so they will not add to the cooking time.
Any of the following can be added during the last half hour of cooking: minced onion, garlic or green pepper, diced carrots or celery, chopped tomatoes, or cooked meat.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Sort: Before soaking beans, pick them over and remove any damaged beans, small stones or dirt.
directions.3:
Soak: Most beans will rehydrate to triple their dry size, so be sure to start with a large enough pot. Choose one of the following ways to soak your beans:
	* Hot Soak: Hot soaking helps reduce intestinal gas. For each pound of dry beans, add 10 cups hot water; heat to boiling and let boil 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and set aside for up to 4 hours.
	* Quick Soak: For each pound of dry beans, add 10 cups hot water; heat to boiling and let boil 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and set aside for at least one hour.
	* Overnight Soak: For each pound (2 cups) dry beans, add 10 cups cold water and let soak overnight, or at least 8 hours.
directions.4: Cook: Drain soaking water and rinse beans. Cover beans with fresh water. Simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 hours until tender.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Measure the masa harina and salt into a large bowl. Cut the butter into tablespoon-sized pieces and work it into the dry ingredients using the back of a wooden spoon. Add the water and mix with a wooden spoon or with your hands until a soft dough forms. Cover the dough with a clean cloth and let rest for 5 minutes.
directions.3: Divide the dough into 12 pieces and roll each piece into a ball.
directions.4: To keep the dough from sticking to the tortilla press, put a piece of plastic wrap (or a plastic bag) on the bottom surface of the press. Put a ball of dough in the center of the plastic. Then place another piece of plastic wrap on the top of the dough. Press the dough flat in the press.
directions.5: Pick up the tortilla with the plastic on both sides. Peel off one piece of plastic (which can be reused). Flip the tortilla off of the plastic onto a hot griddle. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes, until the bottom of the tortilla becomes golden. Flip the tortilla and press lightly with a spatula, which will make the tortilla puff slightly. Cook for one to two minutes more, until the tortilla appears to be done.

Bake according to the package directions. Let cool. Crumble 4 cups for the cornbread with your fingers and use as directed in the recipe.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.

Stir the batter up from the bottom now and then to keep it well mixed. Cook until top is covered with bubbles and the bottom is brown. Loosen edges of each pancake all around. ingredients: 1 teaspoon vegetable oil (to grease baking pan)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Add 1/2 teaspoon of poultry seasoning to milk.
directions.4: Combine remaining 1/2 teaspoon of poultry seasoning and all other spices (except paprika) with cornflake crumbs and place in a plastic bag.
directions.5: Dip chicken into milk, shake to remove excess, then quickly shake in bag with seasoning and crumbs.
directions.6: Refrigerate for 1 hour.
directions.7: Remove from refrigerator and sprinkle lightly with paprika for color.
directions.8: Evenly space chicken on greased baking pan. Cover with aluminum foil and bake for 40 minutes.
directions.9: Remove foil and continue baking for an additional 30 to 40 minutes or until the meat can be easily pulled away form the bone with a fork. The drumsticks may require less baking time than the breasts. Crumbs will form a crispy "skin." (Do not turn chicken during baking.)
