directions.2: Use leftover cooked chicken, or cook enough chicken to make 2 cups of chicken pieces.
directions.3: Chop the celery and green pepper into small pieces.
directions.4: Peel and chop 1/4 of an onion.
directions.5: Peel and chop half of a cucumber.
directions.6: Chop the apple into pieces. It’s okay to leave the peel on the apple.
directions.7: Cut the grapes in half.
directions.8: Put all the ingredients in a large bowl. Stir together.

ingredients: 1/4 cup zucchini (washed and cut into small strips)
1/4 cup summer squash (yellow, washed and cut into small strips)
1/8 cup green bell pepper (seeded and diced)
Crunchy Vegetable Wraps.notes:
Be creative. Try different vegetables, herbs, and spices. For examples, try green beans, lettuce, radishes, corn; dill, oregano, basil, mint, curry, or chili powder.
You can substitute pre-made flavored cream cheeses, such as chive, herb, or vegetable.
Try a sweet cream cheese and add fruit to your wrap for a different twist.
This wrap is great with soup or salad or served as a cool summer appetizer!

Learn more about:

Broccoli
Carrots
Zucchini
Summer Squash
Tomatoes
Bell Peppers
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a small bowl, stir ranch dressing into cream cheese; chill.
directions.3: Wash and chop vegetables.
directions.4: Steam broccoli in microwave for 1 minute with 1 tablespoon of water.
directions.5: Spread cream cheese onto flour tortilla, staying one inch from edge. Sprinkle vegetables over cream cheese. Roll tortilla tightly.
directions.6: Chill for 1 to 2 hours before serving (the wrap will hold its shape better). With a sharp knife slice into circles and serve.

Crustless Pumpkin Pie.notes:
Recipe for Master Mix. 1/2 serving of mix = 1/2 cup
Learn more about:

Pumpkins

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 350 °F and lightly grease a 9 or 10 inch pie plate.
directions.3: Combine all ingredients in a medium mixing bowl or a blender.
directions.4: Beat 2 minutes with a mixer until smooth, or blend in the blender on high for one minute.
directions.5: Pour into the pie plate.
directions.6: Bake until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean, about 50 to 55 minutes.
directions.7: Cool slightly and keep refrigerated.
directions.8: Serve with whipped topping or ice cream.

ingredients: 6 scallions (sliced including white and green parts)
Crusty Rice with Tofu and Vegetables.notes:
Learn more about:

Corn
Peas
Onions
Carrots
Herbs

directions.1: To make the rice, cook rice according to the directions on the package. Set aside to cool and dry out.
directions.2: Put the tofu, corn, scallions, carrot, basil, and salt in the bowl and mix well.
directions.3: When the rice has fully cooled, add it to the bowl with the tofu and mix well.
directions.4: Put the skillet over medium high heat and when it is hot, add the oil.
directions.5: Add the rice and tofu mixture; reduce heat to low and press down the rice mixture with a spatula. Cover and cook 10 minutes. Press down again to help form a crust. Flip portions of the rice so that you get chunks of crispy rice. Cook until crispy, up to 20 minutes.

ingredients: 3 cups black beans, canned, low-sodium (or cooked from dry)
Cuban Beans and Rice.notes:
Learn more about:

Garlic
Onions
Bell Peppers
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet. Sauté the garlic, onion, and green bell pepper until golden, about 3 minutes.
directions.3: Stir in the beans, broth, vinegar, and seasoning; bring to a boil then lower to a simmer. Cook covered for 5 minutes.
directions.4: Spoon over cooked rice and serve.

ingredients: 1/4 cup fresh lime juice (1 large or 2 small limes)
1 head Romaine lettuce (washed, patted dry with paper towels, and torn into bite-sized pieces)
Cuban Salad.notes:
For protein, add low-sodium canned tuna or salmon on top of the salad.
Learn more about:

Limes
Garlic
Lettuce
Tomatoes
Onions
Radishes

directions.1: Put the oil, lime juice, garlic, salt, and pepper in the small bowl and mix well. Lemon juice can be used instead of lime juice.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon lime juice, freshly squeezed or bottled
1 medium greenhouse-grown cucumber, cut into small chunks
Cucumber Blueberry Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Limes
Blueberries
Cucumbers
Onions

directions.1: In a small bowl whisk together vinaigrette ingredients.
directions.2: In a large bowl mix together all salad ingredients, except bread.
directions.3: When ready to serve, add vinaigrette to salad and toss.
directions.4: Toast bread, then cut into four pieces.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel and thinly slice cucumber.
directions.3: Mix all other ingredients in the mixing bowl.
directions.4: Add cucumber slices and stir until coated.
directions.5: Chill until serving.

ingredients: 2 teaspoons dill weed (chopped dried or fresh)
Cucumber Salad with Tomatoes.notes:
Learn more about:

Cucumbers
Tomatoes
Onions
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Toss together the cucumbers, tomatoes, onions, couscous (or rice), dill, and salad dressing.
directions.3: Chill for 1 hour.
directions.4: Serve.

ingredients: salt and lemon pepper, to taste (optional)
Cucumber Yogurt and Cream Cheese Dip.notes:
To quickly soften cream cheese, microwave for approximately 20 seconds.
Learn more about:

Cucumbers
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Stir yogurt and cream cheese until smooth.
directions.3: Rinse the cucumber under running water.
directions.4: Slice the cucumber in half the long way and run a spoon down the middle to remove the seeds.
directions.5: Chop the cucumber into small pieces.
directions.6: Stir the cucumber, chopped garlic, and seasonings into the yogurt mixture.

Cucumber, Yogurt and Herb Dip.notes:
Watch how to make this kid-friendly recipe on YouTube.
Learn more about:

Cucumbers
Garlic
Herbs
Lemons
Tomatoes
Broccoli
Carrots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel, seed, and grate one cucumber. Slice other cucumber and set aside.
directions.3: Mix yogurt, grated cucumber, sour cream, lemon juice, dill, and garlic in a serving bowl. Chill for 1 hour.
directions.4: Arrange tomatoes, cucumbers, broccoli, and carrots on a colorful platter. Serve with cucumber dip.

ingredients: 1 red onion, peeled and finely chopped (medium)
2 cups low sodium vegetable broth (or low sodium chicken broth)
Curried Brown Rice with Pumpkin Seeds, A.notes:
Learn more about:

Garlic
Onions
Spinach
Apricots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Rinse the rice well.
directions.3: Heat the oil over medium heat in a large heavy saucepan.
directions.4: Add the onions and garlic and cook for 3 to 4 minutes, then stir in the curry powder.
directions.5: Add the rice and broth and bring to a boil over high heat.
directions.6: Reduce the heat, cover and simmer for 30 to 45 minutes until the liquid is absorbed.
directions.7: Remove from heat and stir in the apricots and spinach.
directions.8: Replace cover and let sit for 10 minutes.
directions.9: Add the pumpkin seeds, salt, pepper (and more curry if desired) and fluff with a fork.
directions.10: Serve immediately.

ingredients: 4 cooked cooled chicken thighs (about 3 cups shredded)
1 tablespoon curry powder (or more to taste)
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro (and/or basil leaves)
Curried Chicken Salad.notes:
If you do not have leftover chicken, you can poach chicken. Put 4 boneless, skinless chicken thighs in a pan and cover with cold water (about 4 cups) and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat and cook for 10 minutes. Turn the heat off, turn the chicken pieces over and set aside for 20 minutes. Remove the thighs with a slotted spoon and set aside to cool completely. Shred and prepare recipe as directed.

You can also substitute 2 cans of drained light tuna, instead of chicken thighs.
Learn more about:

Celery
Apples
Oranges
Herbs

directions.1: Put chicken in a bowl and add remaining ingredients. Mix to combine.
directions.2: Cover and refrigerate at least one hour and up three days.

ingredients: 1 1/2 teaspoons olive oil (extra virgin or virgin)
2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 12 oz, diced into 1 inch cubes)
1/2 medium red bell pepper (cut into 3/4" squares)
Curried Chicken with Raisins and Mushroo.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Add a side salad with light dressing and an 8 oz glass of fat-free milk.
Time Saving Ideas: Purchase sliced mushrooms, fresh or frozen bell pepper strips, and pre-cooked, diced chicken.
Learn more about:

Mushrooms
Bell Peppers

directions.1: Heat olive oil in large sauté pan.
directions.2: With heat on medium-high, place chicken in pan and cover with lid.
directions.3: Cook chicken about 5 minutes.
directions.4: Add mushrooms and peppers to pan and sauté 3 to 4 minutes.
directions.5: Add chicken broth.
directions.6: Gently mix in raisins, rice, and curry powder; bring to boil, reduce heat and cover.
directions.7: Simmer until rice is done; fluff with fork and let sit 3 to 5 minutes before serving.

ingredients: 2 cans chickpeas, low-sodium, rinsed and drained (15 ounces)
Curried Chickpea Salad.notes:
Add the Curried Chickpea Salad to a sandwich and add spinach or lettuce if desired. Also, try topping tossed salad with it instead of salad dressing.
Learn more about:

Celery
Onions
Apples
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Add the chickpeas to a large bowl and mash with a potato masher. You can mash them to be as smooth or coarse as you desire.
directions.3: Add all of the remaining ingredients to the bowl and mix until everything is combined.

Curried Potatoes.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Potatoes
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel the onion, and chop it into small pieces.
directions.3: Peel the potatoes, and chop them into 1 inch cubes.
directions.4: Boil the potatoes in a medium saucepan until they are soft. Drain off the hot water.
directions.5: Add ice cold water to cover the potatoes.
directions.6: Melt the butter on medium heat in a frying pan or skillet.
directions.7: Cook the onion in the butter until it turns yellow.
directions.8: Drain the water from the potatoes, and add them to the frying pan. Stir and cook until they absorb the butter.
directions.9: Add the broth, curry powder, and lemon juice.
directions.10: Cook until the potatoes have absorbed the broth.

ingredients: 1 head of cauliflower (about 1 1/2 pounds, trimmed and cut into small florets)
Curried Quinoa and Cauliflower.notes:
Learn more about:

Peas
Garlic
Cauliflower
Herbs
Limes
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook quinoa until just tender, according to package directions.
directions.3: Heat oil in saucepan over medium-high heat. Add curry powder and cumin, and cook, about 30 seconds, or until fragrant.
directions.4: Stir in broth and chopped garlic. Bring to a boil.
directions.5: Add cauliflower, cover, and return to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 3 minutes.
directions.6: Add frozen peas and cook until cauliflower is just tender, stirring occasionally. Remove from heat.
directions.7: Stir in 2 tablespoons broth from cauliflower fixture into yogurt in small bowl.
directions.8: Add yogurt mixture to cauliflower. Fold in quinoa, cashews, and cilantro.
directions.9: Sprinkle with green onion and top with a little fresh lime juice.

ingredients: 1 can (14.5 ounce) low-sodium diced tomatoes (including liquid)
1 can (15.5 ounce) low-sodium white beans or chickpeas (drained and rinsed)
Curried Squash Stew.notes:
For additional flavor, add 1/2 cup raisins.
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Celery
Zucchini
Butternut Squash
Tomatoes

directions.1: Heat a large pot on the stove over medium heat and add oil. Add the onion, garlic and celery and cook about 10 minutes, until the onion is tender.
directions.2: Add zucchini and curry powder and cook for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
directions.3: Add the butternut squash, tomatoes and chickpeas and cover. Continue cooking about 10 minutes.
directions.4: Serve with cooked brown rice.

Curry Dip.notes: Serve with bite-sized raw vegetables, crackers, or pita bread.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix the sour cream, yogurt, and curry powder.
directions.3: Store the dip in a covered container if you don’t plan to eat it right away.
directions.4: Keep the dip in the fridge until you serve it.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix ingredients in a bowl.
directions.3: Chill.
directions.4: Serve with crisp raw vegetables pieces, such as celery, carrot, or summer squash sticks.

Curtido Salvadoreno (Cabbage Salad).notes:

Cabbage
Carrots
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Blanch the cabbage with boiling water for 1 minute. Discard the water.
directions.3: Place the cabbage in a large bowl and add grated carrots, sliced onion, red pepper, oregano, olive oil, salt, brown sugar, vinegar, and water.
directions.4: Place in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours before serving.

ingredients: 3/4 cup canned, drained, no-salt added chickpeas (garbanzo beans)
Dave\u2019s Herb-Stuffed Mushrooms.notes:

Herbs

directions.1: Preheat oven to 375 °F.
directions.2: Clean mushrooms with a paper towel or vegetable brush; remove stems to use for the filling.
directions.3: While oven is warming, put mushroom caps (open side down) in oven for 10 minutes. This will prepare the caps for stuffing.
directions.4: Chop the garlic and onions and sauté with 1 teaspoon of olive oil. One minute before they are finished, add the four herbs. After 1 minute, remove from heat.
directions.5: In a large bowl, mash mushroom stems and chickpeas.
directions.6: Add all other ingredients. Mix well.
directions.7: Lightly spray a baking sheet and the mushroom caps.
directions.8: Stuff the mushrooms with the mixture and place on baking sheet.
directions.9: Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until the stuffing is golden brown.
directions.10: Remove from oven, sprinkle with an herb of your choice, and enjoy.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Stir all ingredients (except for the pie crust) together in a medium sized mixing bowl and place in a 10-inch deep dish pie pan.
directions.3: Place one pie crust on top of the fruits. Cut 3 or 4 slits to allow the steam to escape.
directions.4: Bake at 375 °F for about an hour. Serve warm. Refrigerate any leftovers.

ingredients: 3 1/2 cups mustard or collard greens (about 1/2 pound, rinsed, stems removed, and coarsely shredded)
Delicious Greens.notes:
Learn more about:

Greens
Cabbage
Onions
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Rinse greens, remove stems, and tear in small pieces.
directions.3: In a large saucepan, boil 3 quarts of water.
directions.4: Add mustard greens, return to a boil and cook 3 minutes. Add cabbage and cook 1 more minute. Drain in colander.
directions.5: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and sauté garlic and onion until light brown, about 3 minutes.
directions.6: Add greens and vinegar and cook briefly, about 3 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients: 2 cups lentils (dry, washed, soaking not necessary)
1 can whole tomatoes, low-sodium (14.5 ounce, cut into pieces or 3-4 fresh tomatoes cut in wedges)
Delicious Lentil Stew.notes:
Learn more about:

Carrots
Onions
Celery
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Melt butter in a large skillet.
directions.3: Sauté onion until tender.
directions.4: Add water, lentils, Worcestershire sauce, oregano, and garlic powder.
directions.5: Cover, bring to a boil. Reduce heat, and simmer for 45 minutes.
directions.6: Add carrots, celery, and salt.
directions.7: Cover and simmer 30 minutes more or until the vegetables are tender.
directions.8: Add tomatoes. Heat thoroughly and serve.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Scrub potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch strips.
directions.3: Place potato strips into ice water, cover, and chill for 1 hour or longer.
directions.4: Remove potatoes and dry strips thoroughly.
directions.5: Place garlic powder, onion powder, salt, white pepper, allspice, and pepper flakes in plastic bag.
directions.6: Toss potatoes in spice mixture.
directions.7: Brush potatoes with oil.
directions.8: Place potatoes in nonstick shallow baking pan.
directions.9: Cover with aluminum foil and place in 475 °F oven for 15 minutes.
directions.10: Remove foil and continue baking uncovered for additional 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Turn fries occasionally to brown on all sides.

Delicious Tacos.notes:
Learn more about:

Mushrooms
Bell Peppers
Onions
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Sauté onion, garlic and jalapeno, add cumin and black pepper. When everything is soft, add red pepper and mushrooms. Sauté for 2 more minutes.
directions.3: Serve over tortilla and garnish with cut tomatoes and cilantro or cilantro sauce.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Hard boil eggs by placing eggs in a saucepan and covering them with water. Bring to a boil.
directions.3: Reduce heat to simmer; cook for 15 minutes.
directions.4: Immediately rinse under cold water to stop cooking and to make it easy to peel off shells. Refrigerate peeled eggs (without shells) until ready for use.
directions.5: Slice eggs into halves lengthwise. Remove yellow yolks and save whites.
directions.6: Place yolks in a one quart zip lock style bag along with the remaining ingredients (except the egg whites). Press out air.
directions.7: Close bag and knead (mush together) until ingredients are well-blended. (Note: you could also put yolks in a bowl with other ingredients [except the egg whites], and mix together well until they look like a paste).
directions.8: Push contents toward one corner of the bag. Cut about 1/2 inch off the corner of the bag. Squeezing the bag gently, fill reserved egg white hollows with the yolk mixture. (Note if you used a bowl, you can spoon the yolk mixture into the egg whites).
directions.9: Chill to blend flavors.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Thaw frozen fish in refrigerator overnight or thaw in microwave oven. Then, separate into 4 fillets or pieces
directions.3: Place fish in a glass-baking dish. Cover with wax paper.
directions.4: Cook at "medium" power in the microwave for 3 minutes. Remove cover, turn fish over, and sprinkle with lemon juice and seasonings.
directions.5: Cover and continue cooking at "medium" power for 3 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork.

ingredients: 1/2 can low-sodium kidney beans, drained (about 8 ounces )
Dirty Rice.notes:
Tip for cooking ground beef: The recommended safe minimum internal temperature for ground beef is 160 °F, as measured with a food thermometer.
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Peas

directions.1: In a small bowl, combine dried egg mix and water. Mix well and set aside.
directions.2: In a large skillet, cook ground beef, onion, and green pepper in oil over medium heat for about 10 minutes.
directions.3: Add dried egg mix to skillet. Scramble eggs over medium heat for about 5 minutes.
directions.4: Add peas and beans to skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes.
directions.5: Add rice and pepper to skillet. Stir to break up any clumps of rice. Cook for about 5 minutes. Serve hot.

ingredients: acidic fruit juice (lemon, lime, orange, pineapple) to reduce browning (optional)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Slice bananas into 1/8 to 1/4-inch slices.
directions.3: (Optional) Dip banana slices into fruit juice to reduce browning. Sprinkle with cinnamon or other flavorings if desired.
directions.4: Dry until pieces bend like thick leather and no longer feel sticky.

ingredients: 2 Servings of Better Baking Mix (2 cups)
Drop Biscuits (from Better Baking Mix).notes:
Try these variations on this recipe:
Herb Biscuits - Add to dry ingredients: 1 teaspoon Italian herb mix.
Cheese Biscuits - Add to dry ingredients: 1/3 cup grated sharp cheese.
Fruit Scones - Add to the dry ingredients: 1/4 cup sugar, 1/2 cup raisins or dried cranberries, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, or the grated rind of an orange or lemon. Reduce water to 2/3 cup.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F. Lightly grease baking sheet.
directions.3: Add oil and water to the dry mix. Stir just until all ingredients are wet.
directions.4: Drop spoonsful 4 inches apart on baking sheet.
directions.5: Bake 10 to 12 minutes until lightly browned.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon nuts (as topping or crunchy cereal)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
directions.3: Cover and refrigerate until chilled.
directions.4: Eat and enjoy as a snack or as a dessert.

Dutch Green Beans.notes:
Learn more about:

Green Beans
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain the beans, and save the liquid from the can in small bowl.
directions.3: Pour 1/2 cup bean liquid into the saucepan.
directions.4: Add the cornstarch in the bean liquid. Stir well.
directions.5: Add the vinegar and brown sugar.
directions.6: Put on medium heat and bring to a boil.
directions.7: Turn the heat to low.
directions.8: Add the green beans and onions. Heat and serve.

Eagle Nest.notes:
Adults: If preparing with children, use a can opener to open peaches. Drain juice and discard sharp edged lid.
Learn more about:

Peaches

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place one peach half, cut side up, in center of plate for nest.
directions.3: Place 1 tablespoon of cottage cheese in center of nest.
directions.4: Place raisins on cottage cheese to make eggs.
directions.5: Enjoy your Eagle Nest.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: When bananas have become very ripe, peel and slice them into medium size round pieces. Place on a plastic wrap covered baking sheet and put in freezer overnight.
directions.3: Place frozen bananas in a food processor or blender with a small splash of milk (not over 1/4 cup total).
directions.4: Pulse food processor or blender until bananas begin to break up. They will be tiny balls of bananas at this point.
directions.5: Using a spoon or rubber spatula, scrape down the banana mixture. Continue running the food processor until the mixture is smooth and creamy. This may take a few minutes. The ice cream will look and tasted like soft serve ice cream when finished.
directions.6: Serve in an ice cream cone or in a small bowl with a small ribbon of chocolate syrup on top (optional).

ingredients: 2 cans black beans, low-sodium (15.5 ounces, drained and rinsed)
2 cups chicken broth, low-sodium (can use low-sodium vegetable broth instead)
4 tablespoons sour cream, low-fat (can use fat-free)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Lightly purée one can of black beans with broth, salsa, and cumin in a blender.
directions.3: In a medium saucepan, combine puréed bean mixture with remaining beans and heat through.
directions.4: To serve, ladle soup into 4 bowls.
directions.5: Top each bowl with one tablespoon of sour cream and garnish with the cilantro.

ingredients: 4 tablespoons maple syrup or honey (can replace with 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper per squash half for a savory flavor)
Easy Baked Acorn Squash.notes:
This recipe contains one or more ingredients considered to be traditional or indigenous to Native American communities in certain regions across North America.
Learn more about:

Butternut Squash

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Cut acorn squash in half and scoop out seeds.
directions.4: Fill a baking pan with about 1/2 inch of water.
directions.5: Place the squash in the pan, flesh side up. If they are lopsided, slice the underside horizontally so the bottom sits flat on the pan.
directions.6: Add 1 tablespoon maple syrup or honey (or ground pepper if you prefer a savory flavor) to each half and spread evenly across the flesh.
directions.7: Bake for about 1 hour, or until flesh is tender.
directions.8: Serve as a side with meat or another main dish.

ingredients: 2 cans (about 30 ounces) low-sodium diced tomatoes, drained
1 can (about 15 ounces) low-sodium kidney beans, drained
Easy Beef Supper.notes:
Tip for cooking ground beef: The recommended safe minimum internal temperature for ground beef is 160 °F, as measured with a food thermometer.
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Tomatoes
Herbs

directions.1: In a large pan, cook ground beef over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain fat.
directions.2: Add onion, green pepper, and tomatoes to ground beef and cook until onion turns light brown.
directions.3: Turn down the heat to a simmer. Add macaroni, tomato juice, spices, and beans to the pan. Stir well.
directions.4: Cover the pan and simmer for about 20 minutes.
directions.5: Remove pan from heat, stir, and serve hot.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix 2 tablespoons flour and water in a pan until smooth.
directions.3: Slowly stir in broth.
directions.4: Cook over medium heat until thickened.
directions.5: Add chicken, salt (optional) and pepper.

ingredients: 1 can cream of chicken soup, reduced sodium (10 3/4 ounce, condensed)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Pre-heat oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Mix vegetables, chicken, and soup in ungreased, 9-inch pie plate
directions.4: Stir remaining ingredients in a mixing bowl with fork until blended. Pour over vegetables and chicken in pie plate.
directions.5: Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown.
directions.6: Let cool for 5 minutes and serve.

ingredients: 1 cup green bell pepper (cut into strips)
Easy Eggplant Stir Fry.notes:

Eggplant

Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place eggplant, zucchini, green bell pepper, onions and salad dressing into a skillet.
directions.3: Stir lightly to combine and cook over low heat until tender.
directions.4: Stir in cherry tomatoes and cook for 3-5 minutes. Serve over cooked brown rice.

ingredients: 3 1/2 cups brown rice, cooked (or white rice)
1 cup chicken breast, ham or pork, cooked (and chopped)
soy sauce or hot sauce (optional, to taste)

Peas

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.

directions.4: Add the rest of oil (2 teaspoons) to pan. Stir fry rice, breaking up lumps by pressing rice against pan.

directions.6: Add green onions, reserved eggs and sauce to taste. Serve hot.
directions.7: Cover and refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

Easy Fruit Salad.notes:

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix fruit in a large bowl.
directions.3: Add yogurt and mix well.
directions.4: Chill in refrigerator before serving.

ingredients: 6 romaine lettuces leaves (torn into 1 1/2 inch pieces)

Lettuce

Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine lettuce, cucumber, tomato, onion, and cheese in large serving bowl. Whisk together oil, lemon juice, oregano, and salt in small bowl.
directions.3: Pour over lettuce mixture; toss until coated. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil or cooking oil
1 large red, yellow, or white onion (chopped)
8 cups low-sodium vegetable or chicken broth (2 quarts)
Easy Lentil Soup.notes:

Onions

Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Sauté onions, carrots, red pepper flakes, and garlic in oil until soft.
directions.3: Add tomatoes, bay leaf, salt, and pepper and stir well.
directions.4: Add rinsed lentils and broth and simmer until lentils are soft, about 30 minutes. Keep checking lentils until they are done.
directions.5: Season with additional salt and pepper, if desired.

Easy Mango Salsa.notes:
Learn more about:

Mangos
Bell Peppers
Onions
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel and chop the mango, be sure to remove the seed.
directions.3: Cut the pepper and onion into small pieces.
directions.4: Mix all the ingredients together.

ingredients: 4 cans crushed tomatoes, low sodium (14.5 oz cans)
Easy Marinara Sauce.notes:
This recipe freezes well. Defrost in the refrigerator overnight, then reheat and eat!
Learn more about:

Onions
Carrots
Celery
Tomatoes
Spinach

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash the vegetables.
directions.3: Collect, dice, and measure all ingredients before starting to prepare the recipe.
directions.4: Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat.
directions.5: Add the onion and garlic powder. Cook for about 10 minutes or until the onion is clear.
directions.6: Add the carrots and celery, and cook for 5 minutes until slightly soft.
directions.7: Add the tomatoes and Italian seasoning. Stir until all ingredients are mixed together. Taste, and add a little bit of salt and pepper if desired.
directions.8: Turn the heat to medium-high, and bring sauce to a boil.
directions.9: Once boiling, reduce the heat to low. Simmer uncovered for at least 30 minutes.
directions.10: Stir in the spinach, and cook for 2 minutes until spinach wilts.*
directions.11: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours. Eat within 3 to 5 days.

ingredients: 2 cans diced tomatoes (14.5 ounce cans, low-sodium, drained)
1 can diced green chiles ( 4.5 ounce can, drained)
Easy No-Cook Salsa.notes:
Learn more about:

Tomatoes
Onions
Herbs
Lemons
Limes
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large bowl, stir together all the ingredients until well mixed. Cover and chill at least 4 hours.
directions.3: Serve with Baked Tortilla Chips or raw vegetables.

ingredients: 1 cup frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained
1 pound frozen pollock, or other white fish, such as haddock or cod (partially thawed)
Easy Oven Fish with Spinach Basil Dippin.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with 100% fruit juice and green beans or asparagus.
Learn more about:

Spinach
Herbs
Garlic
Apples

directions.1: Place rack in center and heat oven to 450 °F. Spray cookie sheet with cooking spray.
directions.2: To make dipping sauce, place all ingredients in a blender or food processor; blend or process until smooth.
directions.3: Cut pollock into strips 1-inch wide (easiest when fish is partially, rather than full, thawed) and place on prepared baking sheet.
directions.4: Mix breading ingredients (bread crumbs, Parmesan cheese, and pepper) in a shallow dish or pie pan; place flour and egg whites in separate dishes.
directions.5: Dip fish sticks in flour, then in egg whites, then breading mix, coating evenly.
directions.6: Return coated fish sticks to baking sheet, spacing evenly. Cook fish until it is 145 °F, confirmed with a food thermometer, about 10 to 12 minutes, golden brown, turning as needed.
directions.7: While fish sticks are baking, cut apples in quarters and core them; slice into smaller wedges (about 12 per apple).
directions.8: Toss with raisins, pecans, and cinnamon.
directions.9: Heat butter in medium sauce pan. Add fruit mix.
directions.10: Sauté lightly about 3 to 5 minutes. Apples should still be slightly crisp.

ingredients: 1/2 yellow bell pepper, cut into 1" chunks
1 cup green beans (fresh, frozen, or canned)
1 pound tilapia fillets, fresh, or frozen (4-4-oz tilapia fillets)
1 tablespoon salt-free Caribbean citrus seasoning blend
Easy Oven Packet Caribbean Tilapia with.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with an 8 ounce glass of non-fat milk.
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Bell Peppers
Green Beans
Tomatoes
Onions
Garlic
Pears

directions.1: Heat oven to 425 °F.
directions.2: Scrub potatoes under running water, cut into 1-inch chunks.
directions.3: In a large bowl, toss potatoes with other vegetables, seasonings, and olive oil. Spread mix in a 2-quart baking dish and place in oven.
directions.4: Roast until potatoes and other vegetables are tender, about 30 to 40 minutes.
directions.5: About 15 minutes after the potato dish was placed in the oven, put in a baking sheet with fish packets, prepared as follows:
directions.6: Brush fish with olive oil, coat with seasoning blend.
directions.7: Place each filet in the center of a square of aluminum foil (or substitute foil with parchment paper).
directions.8: Cut pears into quarters and core; slice into thin wedges (about 8 to 12 per pear).Top fish with pear wedges.
directions.9: Bring the foil over the fish and fruit. Fold and pinch the seams.
directions.10: Place foil packets on a baking sheet. Bake about 20 minutes, until tilapia is cooked to an internal temperature of 145 °F, confirmed with a food thermometer, and fruit is tender.
directions.11: To serve, carefully open the packet, slide contents onto individual serving plates, and add roasted vegetables.

ingredients: 1 green bell pepper (medium, washed, seeded and chopped)
2 cans diced tomatoes, low-sodium (14.5 ounces each)
1 can kidney beans, low-sodium (15.5 oz, drained and rinsed)
Easy Red Beans and Rice.notes:
See how to make this recipes and more on USDA’s MyPlate Kitchen YouTube website.
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Spray skillet with cooking oil spray, if using.
directions.3: Cook onion and pepper over medium heat for 5 minutes or until tender.
directions.4: Add garlic powder, tomatoes, and kidney beans.
directions.5: Bring mixture to a boil.
directions.6: Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes.
directions.7: Serve over rice.

ingredients: 1 teaspoon butter or margarine (optional - used in analysis)
Easy Rice Pudding.notes: A 9-10 year-old child can learn how to use measuring spoons and cups while helping make this recipe.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine rice, water, and butter or margarine in large microwave safe dish. Cover loosely, so steam will escape.
directions.3: Cook in microwave on high for 5 minutes or until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce setting to defrost (50% power), and cook an additional 10 minutes.
directions.4: Mix other ingredients together while rice is cooking.
directions.5: Without allowing rice to cool, remove cover and quickly stir milk-water-raisin mixture into hot rice. Cover loosely again and continue cooking on defrost (50% power) for 10 minutes. After cooking time is finished, let pudding sit, covered, for 10 minutes.
directions.6: Stir gently and put in individual serving dishes.
directions.7: Eat warm or cover and refrigerate immediately. Enjoy the refrigerated pudding within 2 days.

ingredients: 1 package frozen chopped spinach, thawed (10 ounces)
1 1/2 cups mozzarella, part skim shredded (save 1/2 cup for topping)
1 jar light tomato basil pasta sauce, low-sodium (24 ounces)
Easy Stuffed Pasta Shells.notes:
Try this recipe for a potluck or make-ahead dinner. If desired, refrigerate the ready-to-bake casserole.
To lower sodium, use reduced sodium spaghetti sauce.

Learn more about:

Spinach
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 375 °F. Lightly coat a 13x9x2 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Set aside.
directions.3: Drain spinach by placing in a sieve or colander over the sink, or in a bowl and pressing with a spool to remove as much liquid as possible, or squeeze out liquid with clean hands. Place spinach in medium bowl.
directions.4: Add the cottage cheese, 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese, oregano, and pepper to the spinach. Stir to mix thoroughly.
directions.5: Pour half of the spaghetti sauce into prepared baking dish. Add water and stir into the mix.
directions.6: Spoon about 3 tablespoons cheese mixture into each uncooked pasta shell and arrange in a single layer over top.
directions.7: Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese evenly over sauce.
directions.8: Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 1 hour or until shells are tender. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

ingredients: 1 Serving of Better Baking Mix (1 cup)
Easy-As-A-Mix Pizza (from Better Baking.notes:
Use leftover tomato sauce from a can within 5 days, or freeze to use later.
Learn more about:

Onions
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 425 °F. Grease a 12x15 inch or larger baking sheet, or 12-inch pizza pan.
directions.3: Measure mix into a bowl. Add oil and water. Stir to form soft dough.
directions.4: Transfer dough onto baking sheet. Sprinkle with flour. Dip fingers in flour and pat dough into a circle about 11-12 inches across.
directions.5: Spread pizza crust with tomato sauce. Leave about 1/2 inch around edge with no sauce.
directions.6: Sprinkle with onion, seasoning and cheese
directions.7: Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are brown and cheese is melted and starting to brown.
directions.8: Refrigerate any leftovers within 2 hours.

Eating Smart Seasoning Mix.notes:
Recipe makes about 2.5 cups, one serving size = 1/4 cup. This recipe is used in the Chili Tomato Macaroni and Beef & Potatoes recipes.
Learn more about:

Garlic
Herbs
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients.
directions.3: Store in airtight container.
directions.4: Use in recipes as indicated.

ingredients: 1/2 cup chicken, cooked and diced (or beef)
Egg Foo Young.notes:
Use only clean eggs with no cracks in shells.
Learn more about:

Onions
Mushrooms

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Beat eggs with electric mixer (or by hand) until very thick and light, about 5 minutes.
directions.3: Fold in bean sprouts, chicken or beef, mushrooms, and onion.
directions.4: Heat oil in frying pan over moderate heat.
directions.5: Pour egg mixture by half cupsful into the pan. Brown on one side; turn and brown the other side. Keep warm while preparing the sauce.
directions.6: Mix sauce ingredients in small saucepan until smooth.
directions.7: Cook over low heat, stirring constantly, until thickened.
directions.8: Serve sauce over patties.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put the eggs in a pan of cold water. Simmer for 20 minutes.
directions.3: Cool promptly in cold water, then in refrigerator, so the eggs will be easy to shell.
directions.4: Remove the shells from eggs, and chop the eggs finely.
directions.5: Mix all the ingredients together.

Eggplant and Pepper Dip.notes:
Try this low-fat dip with cut vegetables, toast, or as a spread on sandwiches.
Learn more about:

Eggplant
Bell Peppers
Onions
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Use a vegetable peeler to remove the peel from the eggplant.
directions.3: Chop the eggplant into 1 inch cubes.
directions.4: Chop the red peppers.
directions.5: Peel and chop the onion.
directions.6: Put all the ingredients in a large bowl. Stir together.
directions.7: Spread the ingredients on a baking tray.
directions.8: Bake at 400 °F for 45 minutes. While the dip is baking, stir it a few times.
directions.9: When the eggplant is lightly browned and soft, take the dip out of the oven.
directions.10: Let the dip cool for at least 10 minutes.
directions.11: Put the dip the blender. Blend until smooth.
directions.12: Serve the dip cold or at room temperature.

Eggs over Kale and Sweet Potato Grits.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with an 8-ounce glass of 100% grapefruit juice.
Learn more about:

Sweet Potatoes
Kale

directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.2: Coat 4 individual soufflé dishes with 1 tsp vegetable oil.
directions.3: Make 3 to 4 slits in sweet potatoes; cook in microwave until just soft.
directions.4: When sweet potatoes are cool enough to handle, peel, cut into chunks, and puree in food processor.
directions.5: Heat remaining vegetable oil in sauce pan, and sauté kale about 5 minutes.
directions.6: In a medium sauce pan, boil water and milk, add grits and sweet potatoes; cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat; stir in sautéed kale.
directions.7: Divide grits mixture evenly among 4 soufflé dishes (or place all in casserole dish).
directions.8: Make 4 depressions in the grits mixture with the back of a large spoon. Carefully break one egg into each hollow.
directions.9: Bake uncovered for 30 minutes until eggs are cooked. Let cool 10 minutes before serving.

Elaine\u2019s Green-Mash Potatoes.notes:
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Garlic
Peas

directions.1: Simmer peeled, diced potatoes for about 10 minutes until soft when pierced with a fork.
directions.2: Cook 1 cup peas in microwave for about 3 minutes; drain and reserve.
directions.3: Heat milk until hot. Add garlic cloves to milk and let stand for 5 minutes.
directions.4: Puree peas, 1/4 cup milk, and garlic cloves using a blender.
directions.5: Drain potatoes and begin to mash.
directions.6: Slowly add 3/4 cup milk while mashing.
directions.7: Blend in the puréed peas and garlic, margarine, and white pepper (optional) to the mashed potatoes.
directions.8: Place mashed potatoes in a serving dish and keep warm.
directions.9: Just before serving, lightly sprinkle Kosher salt on top of potatoes.

ingredients: 2 cups black beans, cooked (or low-sodium canned)
1 cup kernel corn (1/2 of a 15.2 ounce can, low-sodium, drained and rinsed)
Enchilada Bake.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Corn

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heat; sauté onion and garlic 2 to 3 minutes.
directions.3: Add beans, corn, cumin and 1/2 cup salsa. Cook 3-4 minutes, coarsely mashing beans with back of spoon.
directions.4: Spoon 1/3 cup filling onto each tortilla; roll up.
directions.5: Spoon 1/2 cup salsa into 11x7x2 inch baking dish. Arrange tortillas seam side down; top with remaining 1 cup sauce.
directions.6: Cover and bake in 350 °F oven for 15 to 20 minutes.
directions.7: Uncover; top with cheese. Bake 2 minutes longer or until cheese is melted.

ingredients: 3 1/2 cups green enchilada sauce (28 oz can)
1 can pinto beans, low-sodium (15.5 ounce, drained and rinsed)
1 can corn, low-sodium (drained, 15.2 ounce or 1 1/2 cups frozen corn)
10 ounces Monterey Jack cheese, reduced-fat (2 1/2 cups shredded)
Enchilada Casserole.notes:
Cook rice according to package directions.
If you made two pans, you can freeze one of them before baking. Double-wrap in foil and it will keep for up to 1 month in the freezer.

Learn more about:

Corn

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Drain and rinse the beans and corn (if using canned corn).
directions.4: Collect and measure all ingredients before starting to prepare the recipe.
directions.5: In a large bowl, mix enchilada sauce, beans, cooked rice, and corn.
directions.6: Place half of mixture on the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan or split it between two 9 inch square or round pans.
directions.7: Spread the corn tortillas evenly over the mixture. Place remaining mixture on top of tortillas.
directions.8: Top mixture with cheese, and cover with foil. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes.
directions.9: Remove foil, and bake for 10 more minutes or until cheese is melted and sauce is bubbly.
directions.10: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours. Eat within 3 to 5 days.

ingredients: 1 pound 90% lean ground beef (or other ground meat)
1/2 cup onion (chopped, or 1 Tbsp onion powder)
1 can whole corn, low-sodium (15.2 ounce, or any low-sodium canned vegetable, drained)
4 tablespoons taco seasoning mix (dry, or dry enchilada sauce)
mushrooms, olives or any favorite vegetable (1/2 cup sliced, optional)
Enchilada Rice.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Corn
Mushrooms

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook meat and onion until onion juices are clear.
directions.3: Drain juice and fat from cooked meat and onions.
directions.4: Add corn, taco seasoning, and rice.
directions.5: Simmer for 10 minutes.
directions.6: Add grated cheese to top; cover and let set for 5 minutes.
directions.7: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

ingredients: 1/2 cup mozzarella cheese, shredded, part skim
English Muffin Veggie Pizza.notes:
Try making these pizzas with whole wheat muffins.
Learn more about:

Broccoli
Carrots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cut the broccoli to make 1 cup of chopped broccoli.
directions.3: Put the broccoli in a saucepan with water. Cook on medium until tender.
directions.4: Drain the water from the saucepan. Let the broccoli cool.
directions.5: Cut 4 English muffins in half. Toast the 8 muffin halves.
directions.6: Shred the mozzarella cheese to make 1/2 cup of shredded cheese.
directions.7: Peel and shred the carrots to make 3 tablespoons shredded carrots.
directions.8: Spoon 2 tablespoons pizza sauce over each English muffin half.
directions.9: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon shredded mozzarella cheese on top of each half.
directions.10: Put 2 tablespoons broccoli and 1 teaspoon shredded carrots on top of each half.
directions.11: Sprinkle each half with 1 teaspoon grated parmesan cheese.
directions.12: Toast in the toaster oven for 2 minutes, until the cheese melts.

ingredients: 1 large yellow bell pepper, cut in strips (about 1 1/2 cups)
1 1/2 cups croutons (whole grain if available, about 24 croutons)
European Salad.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with fruit, non-fat milk, and whole grain bread.
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Lettuce
Tomatoes
Raspberries
Herbs

directions.1: Place all vinaigrette ingredients in a blender, blend until smooth; set aside. (Note: Vinaigrette can be made ahead and refrigerated.)
directions.2: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
directions.3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet.
directions.4: Sauté chicken until cooked thoroughly; remove from pan, and let cool.
directions.5: Slice onions.
directions.6: Toss cut vegetables with European blend salad greens.
directions.7: On individual serving plates, top salad with chicken and croutons, drizzle with dressing, and finish with fresh ground pepper, if desired.

ingredients: 8 ounces whole-wheat fettuccine, spaghetti, macaroni, or other noodles
Eve\u2019s Tasty Turkey Tetrazzini.notes:
Learn more about:

Mushrooms
Herbs
Peas

directions.1: Preheat oven to 400 °F. Lightly grease a 9x9 inch baking dish.
directions.2: Cook pasta in a large pot of boiling water until tender. (Check cooking time for pasta; remove pasta approximately 2 minutes early.)
directions.3: While pasta is cooking, melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and thyme. Stir and cook until mushrooms are softened, about 5 minutes.
directions.4: Stir in flour until well blended. (Note: Start with 1/3 cup flour and add more, if needed.)
directions.5: While whisking, slowly add chicken broth and milk. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until sauce is thickened and smooth, about 5 minutes.
directions.6: Add turkey, toasted almonds, frozen peas, and cooked pasta. Gently mix together. Pour into the baking dish and sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
directions.7: Bake until the sauce is bubbling and the cheese is golden brown, 25 to 35 minutes. Let cool 15 minutes before serving.

Fabulous Fig Bars.notes:
No dried figs? Use 3 cups chopped fresh figs. Omit the hot water and orange juice, but add 1 teaspoon lemon or orange zest (grate the outer colored part of the peel).
Margarine used for nutrition and cost analysis.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F. Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking pan.
directions.3: Combine figs, walnuts, sugar, orange juice, and hot water in a mixing bowl and set aside.
directions.4: Mix together margarine or butter and brown sugar until creamy. Add egg and mix until smooth.
directions.5: Mix flour and baking soda. Stir into egg mixture. Blend in oats to make soft dough.
directions.6: Reserve 1 cup of dough for topping. With floured fingertips, press the remaining dough into a thin layer on the bottom of the baking pan.
directions.7: Spread fig mixture evenly over the dough. Crumble reserved dough over top, allowing fig mixture to show.
directions.8: Bake 30 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely in baking pan. Cut into 24 bars (about 2 1/2 x 2 inches).

ingredients: 1 cup frozen strawberries, unsweetened (coarsely chopped, or other fruit, fresh or frozen)

directions.1: Wash your hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oven to 400 °F. Spray muffin tin with non-stick cooking spray.
directions.3: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, and baking soda. Stir well until all ingredients are blended.
directions.4: In another bowl, combine buttermilk, margarine, egg, and vanilla. Pour this mixture into the dry ingredients (made in step #3).
directions.5: Using a large spoon, gently stir ingredients just until moist (do not over-mix). Add fruit and stir gently (do not over-mix).
directions.6: Spoon batter evenly into 9 muffin cups.
directions.7: Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown.
directions.8: Serve hot or cold. Muffins may be frozen for later use.

ingredients: 1 cup dry garbanzo beans (chick peas, sorted and rinsed)
1/3 tablespoon parsley (1 sprig or about 1 teaspoon, chopped)
Falafel with Yogurt Sandwich.notes:
If the batter is too moist, add breadcrumbs to make it thicker. It may take up to a cup of breadcrumbs.
Learn more about:

Garlic
Onions
Herbs
Tomatoes
Lettuce

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put beans and water in large pot and soak by the overnight or quick-soak method.
directions.3: Cook until tender, about 2 hours. Add more water if necessary. Drain.
directions.4: Slowly heat oil and sauté garlic and 1 onion until tender (5 to 7 minutes).
directions.5: Mash cooked beans, sautéed vegetables, parsley, salt, lemon juice and hot pepper sauce until smooth.
directions.6: With floured hands, form ovals with bean mixture (about 1/4 cup each). Roll in flour.
directions.7: Fry falafel, with the remaining oil in skillet, until golden brown. Drain on paper towel.
directions.8: Combine yogurt with remaining onion.
directions.9: Serve falafel in pocket bread topped with yogurt.

Fall Veggie Casserole.notes:
Learn more about:

Eggplant
Tomatoes
Bell Peppers
Onions
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Remove the skin from the eggplant. Cut the eggplant into cubes. Chop the tomatoes into small pieces.
directions.3: Cut the green pepper in half. Remove the seeds and cut it into small pieces.
directions.4: Chop the onion into small pieces.
directions.5: Cut the garlic into tiny pieces.
directions.6: Cook the first 8 ingredients in a large skillet until tender.
directions.7: Top with the Parmesan cheese and serve.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the griddle over medium heat, or set an electric frying pan at 375 °F.
directions.3: Put eggs, milk, and vanilla in a pie pan or shallow bowl and beat with a fork until well mixed.
directions.4: Grease the griddle or pan with a thin layer of oil or use nonstick spray.
directions.5: Dip both sides of bread, one slice at a time, in the egg mixture and cook on the hot griddle or frying pan.
directions.6: Cook on one side until golden brown. Turn the bread over to cook the other side. It will take about 4 minutes on each side.
directions.7: Optional: serve with syrup, applesauce, fruit slices, or jam.

ingredients: 3 red bell peppers (seeded and diced into 1/4 inch pieces)
3 green peppers (seeded and diced into 1/4 inch pieces)
Farmers Market Gazpacho.notes:
Learn more about:

Cucumbers
Bell Peppers
Celery
Tomatoes
Onions
Lemons
Garlic
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients except salt, pepper, and lemons in a bowl.
directions.3: Remove 2 cups of the mixture and reserve.
directions.4: Using a blender or food processor, puree the remaining mixture in the bowl.
directions.5: Add 2 cups of reserved mixture to the pureed mixture.
directions.6: Season with salt, pepper (optional) and the juice from the lemons.
directions.7: Cover mixture and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
directions.8: Serve cold, garnished with chopped cilantro.

ingredients: 1 can black beans, low-sodium (15 ounce, drained and rinsed)
Farmers Market Salsa.notes:
This salsa uses fresh vegetables that are available year-round and add flavor and beautiful color. Kids and grown-ups alike can't resist how good it tastes. If you have a hand-held chopper, this is an easy task for kids in helping with the recipe.

Safety Tip: If cutting the corn off the cob, adult supervision is a good idea.
Learn more about:

Corn
Tomatoes
Onions
Bell Peppers
Limes
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Chill until serving time.
directions.3: Drain before serving.
directions.4: Serve with low-fat baked tortilla chips or fresh vegetables.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Move the oven rack to the center of the oven. Then preheat the oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Spray the bottom and sides of a 9 inch square baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
directions.4: Wash and peel the apples. Cut them into thin slices.
directions.5: Spread the apple slices evenly over the bottom of the baking dish.
directions.6: In a small bowl, use a fork to mix the oatmeal, brown sugar and cinnamon.
directions.7: Spread the oatmeal mix evenly over the apples in the baking dish.
directions.8: Lightly pour the apple juice over the oatmeal mixture.
directions.9: Cover the dish and bake for 20 to 30 minutes until apples are just starting to soften.
directions.10: Uncover and bake for another 15 to 20 minutes until apples are soft.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix 2 1/2 cups whole wheat flour, dry yeast, and non-fat dry milk in large mixer bowl. Add water, oil, and sugar (or honey). Mix well 1 to 2 minutes.
directions.3: Turn off mixer, cover, and let dough sit for 10 minutes.
directions.4: Add eggs and salt. Turn on mixer. Add remaining flour, 1 cup at a time, until dough begins to form a ball.
directions.5: Knead for 5 to 6 minutes. Dough should be very soft and manageable. Stiff dough produces heavy, dry rolls. If dough stiffens while mixing, drizzle a little warm water over dough as it kneads.
directions.6: Dough may be used immediately or covered and stored in the refrigerator for several days.
directions.7: Lightly oil hands and counter top if needed. Shape immediately into rolls. Let rise until very light.
directions.8: Bake at 350 °F for 18 to 20 minutes. Do not overbake.

ingredients: 1 apple (medium, skinned and cored (not cut into pieces))
Festive Microwave Baked Apples.notes:
Fruit is naturally sweet so try making this without sugar.
Learn more about:

Apples

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place apple on plate with opening facing up (cored apples should have bottom intact).
directions.3: Stir sugar, nutmeg, and cinnamon in a separate cup, and sprinkle into and onto apple.
directions.4: Sprinkle raisins on and around apple.
directions.5: Drop butter alternative spread onto apple and cover with plastic wrap or wax paper.
directions.6: Microwave on HIGH for 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
directions.7: Let sit outside of microwave for at least 30 seconds before eating. It will be HOT.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain and mash garbanzo beans in blender, food processor, or with fork. Add remaining ingredients.
directions.3: Blend until smooth.
directions.4: Chill one hour or overnight.
directions.5: Serve on crackers or tortilla chips. Promptly refrigerate leftovers.

ingredients: 1 pound tilapia filets, fresh or frozen (thawed)
1/2 cup yellow corn (frozen or canned, no-salt added)
Fiesta Lettuce Wraps and Pepper Boats.notes:

Fiesta Rice Salad.notes:
Use your favorite vegetables – zucchini, summer squash, corn, greens, kohlrabi, cabbage, or string beans. Use frozen or canned when fresh is unavailable. Grate, chop, cut into small thin strips for different shapes.

Be creative! Try different vinegars – cider, red or white wine, balsamic, rice or white – or flavored vinegars.

Use low calorie salad dressing and leave out the vinegar and oil.

Try a squeeze of lemon or lime juice in place of vinegar!

Try different fresh herbs – cilantro, dill, basil, chives, tarragon, oregano, rosemary, or mint to name a few. Or use dried herbs – but use less.

directions.1: Put the skillet on the stove over high heat. When it is hot, add 1 1/2 teaspoons oil.

directions.3: Reheat the skillet to medium heat. Add the remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons oil, onion, and garlic. Cook about 7 minutes. Add tomatoes and water. Cook about 10 minutes, until the mixture thickens and turns from bright red to an orange color.
directions.4: Return fish to skillet with the tomato mixture. Cover with spinach and sprinkle with olives. Cover skillet. Cook about 2 minutes over low heat until the spinach is steamed. Serve right away.

Flavored Water.notes:
Try these refreshing flavor combinations, or create your own!
Watermelon Lime                             
1 cup watermelon                            
1 lime                                               
5 mint leaves (optional)
 
Cucumber Lemon (or Lime)
1/2 cucumber
1 lemon or lime
 
Pineapple Grape                             
1 cup canned diced pineapple      
Pineapple juice from can             
1 cup grapes
 
Berry Kiwi (or Orange)
10 strawberries or blackberries
1 kiwi or 1 orange
 
Tips for releasing flavors of the produce:
Watermelon: Cut into small pieces (1 to 2 inches).
Citrus fruit (oranges, lemons, limes): Remove rinds, and slice into thin pieces.
Cucumber: Slice into thin pieces.
Mint: Tear leaves.
Grapes: Slice in half.
Berries: Remove top (strawberries only). Slice into small pieces.
Kiwi: Remove peel, and slice into thin pieces.

directions.7: Sprinkle the cereal on top.

ingredients: 1 low fat yogurt, pina colada (8 ounces)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine ingredients. Pour into 3 ounce paper cups.
directions.3: Freeze about 30 minutes; then stick a wooden popsicle/ craft stick in the center of each cup.
directions.4: Freeze overnight until firm. To eat pops, peel off paper cups.
directions.5: For variety, try other fruit flavored yogurts and frozen fruit or fruit juice concentrates.

Fruity Homemade Oatmeal.notes:
To get more fiber, leave the skin on the apple.
Learn more about:

Apples

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Use a vegetable peeler to remove the skin from the apple.
directions.3: Cut the core out of the apple. Chop the apple into small pieces.
directions.4: Put the water in the saucepan.
directions.5: Bring the water to a boil on medium heat.
directions.6: Stir in oatmeal, raisins, chopped apple, and cinnamon.
directions.7: Turn heat to low.
directions.8: Cook 5 minutes, stirring often.

ingredients: 1 can tropical fruit salad in 100% juice (15 ounces)
3 tablespoons reserved juice from tropical fruit salad
1/2 cup natural peanut butter, crunchy or chunky
Fruity Thai Pita Pockets.notes:
Time-saving idea: Purchase pre-opened pita pockets
Learn more about:

Spinach
Herbs

directions.1: In a colander over a bowl, drain fruit salad well; reserve 3 tablespoons juice.
directions.2: In a small bowl, whisk together reserved juice, peanut butter, cream cheese, and soy sauce.
directions.3: Place drained fruit, spinach, and cilantro (if desired) in a bowl; mix gently.
directions.4: Add sauce and toss.
directions.5: Slice a small portion off each pita. Tuck the slice inside the bottom of the pita.
directions.6: Fill each pita pocket with the fruit-spinach mixture.
directions.7: Wrap individually in plastic wrap and refrigerate. Will keep well overnight.

ingredients: 1/8 cup chocolate chips (or 2 tablespoons semi-sweet chips)
2 bananas (large, peeled and cut into quarters)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place chocolate chips in a small microwave safe bowl. Heat on high for 10 seconds and stir. Repeat until chocolate is melted, about 30 seconds.
directions.3: Place fruit on a small tray covered with a piece of waxed paper. Use a spoon to drizzle the melted chocolate on top of the fruit.
directions.4: Sprinkle the fruit with chopped nuts.
directions.5: Cover the fruit and place in the refrigerator for 10 minutes or until the chocolate hardens. Serve chilled.

ingredients: 2 cups kidney beans (cooked, or 15 ounce can, low-sodium)
2 cups great northern beans (cooked, or a 15 ounce can great northern beans, low-sodium)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook ground beef and onions. Drain fat.
directions.3: Add remaining ingredients and mix.
directions.4: Place in casserole dish.
directions.5: Bake in the oven at 350 °F for 1 hour.

ingredients: 46 us fluid ounces tomato juice, low-sodium
1 can beef broth, reduced sodium (14.5 ounces)
Garden Barley Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Herbs
Zucchini
Tomatoes
Bell Peppers

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a Dutch oven or stock pot, combine tomato juice, beef broth, barley, sugar, and seasonings. Bring to boil; reduce heat.
directions.3: Cover; simmer 1 hour.
directions.4: Add vegetables. Return to boil; reduce heat.
directions.5: Cover; simmer 15 to 20 minutes or until vegetables and barley are tender.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon tomato basil garlic seasoning blend, no-salt
2 15.5 oz cans cannellini (white) beans, no-salt-added, drained, and rinsed
Large lettuce leaves (Boston, Bibb, or romaine)
Garden Cannellini Bean Salad.notes:
Serving Suggestion: Serve with a glass of non-fat milk, 1 slice of whole-grain bread, and pear slices.

Tomatoes
Bell Peppers
Cucumbers
Onions
Lettuce

directions.1: Whisk together dressing ingredients in a small bowl.
directions.2: In a small sauté pan, toast almond slivers until golden.
directions.3: Remove from pan and let cool.
directions.4: In a medium bowl, toss dressing with all ingredients except lettuce.
directions.5: Refrigerate until ready to serve.
directions.6: To serve, place lettuce leaves on individual plates; top with salad.

ingredients: 2/3 cup kidney beans (canned, low-sodium, drained and rinsed)
Garden Chili.notes:
Learn more about:

Bell Peppers
Onions
Celery
Corn
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash your hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place ground beef in a skillet sprayed with non-stick cooking spray. Brown meat over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally to break it into pieces. Drain fat and blot meat with paper towels. Transfer beef into a colander and rinse with very hot water to further remove fat.
directions.3: Add green pepper, onion, and celery. Cook until softened.
directions.4: Add beans, corn, tomato sauce, chopped tomatoes, pepper, garlic, and chili powder.
directions.5: Cook mixture over low heat for 20 minutes.
directions.6: Serve hot in bowls. Or serve as a dip with baked tortilla chips or on a bun.
directions.7: Cover and refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

ingredients: 4 cups Italian kale, or other kale variety
Garden Frittata.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with 8-oz glass of fat-free (skim) milk and 1/2 sliced orange.
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Kale
Onions
Bell Peppers

directions.1: Beat eggs, pepper, and salt in large bowl; set aside.
directions.2: Microwave potatoes until slightly soft, but not completely cooked; then cube. (Alternate method without microwave: Cube potatoes and boil 5 minutes until slightly soft; then drain.)
directions.3: Chop remaining vegetables while potatoes cool. Mix vegetables together.
directions.4: Heat oil in a 10-inch non-stick skillet. Sauté vegetables for 5 to 8 minutes; add to eggs and mix well.
directions.5: Pour egg-vegetable mixture into the same skillet. Cook over low to medium heat until eggs are almost set, about 8 to 10 minutes.
directions.6: Cover and let sit until eggs are completely set, about 5 minutes. Egg dishes should be cooked to 160 ºF.

ingredients: 1/2 cup apple (chopped, cored and diced, not peeled)
Garden Orchard Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Broccoli
Carrots
Cauliflower
Apples
Onions

directions.1: Wash your hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix all ingredients together in a serving bowl.
directions.3: Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or longer to allow flavors to blend. Serve cold.
directions.4: Cover and refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

directions.1: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.2: In a medium-sized bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, baking powder, and salt. Set aside.
directions.3: In a small bowl, combine bananas, water, and egg mix. Stir until mixed well.
directions.4: Stir banana mixture into cornmeal mixture. Mix until dry ingredients are moistened. Gently stir in raisins and walnuts.
directions.5: Lightly spray medium-sized skillet or baking pan with nonstick cooking spray.
directions.6: Spoon batter into skillet or baking pan.
directions.7: Bake for 18 to 20 minutes or until bead is golden brown and pulls away from the edges. A wooden toothpick or clean fork inserted into the center of the bread should come out clean.
directions.8: Cut into four equal slices and serve hot or cold.

Garden Pasta Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Cucumbers
Bell Peppers
Herbs

directions.1: In a medium-sized bowl, combine macaroni, onions, cucumbers, and green peppers. Mix well.
directions.2: In a separate bowl, mix vinegar, vegetable oil, salt, and pepper. If using parsley, add that too.
directions.3: Pour the prepared dressing over the pasta. Mix well.
directions.4: Cover bowl and refrigerate for 30 to 45 minutes. Serve cold.

ingredients: 1/4 teaspoon garlic powder (or 1/2 garlic clove, minced)
3 cups chicken broth, low-sodium (or low-sodium beef or vegetable)
1 can green beans, undrained, low-sodium (14 ounces)
1 can diced tomatoes, undrained, low-sodium (14.5 ounces)
Garden Vegetable Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Carrots
Onions
Cabbage
Green Beans
Tomatoes
Zucchini

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large saucepan sprayed with non-stick cooking spray, sauté the carrots, onion, and garlic over low heat about 5 minutes.
directions.3: Add broth, cabbage, green beans, tomatoes, and Italian seasoning; bring to a boil.
directions.4: Cover, lower heat. Simmer about 15 minutes or until carrots are tender.
directions.5: Stir in zucchini and heat for 3 to 4 minutes. Serve hot.
directions.6: Refrigerate leftovers.

Garden Waldorf Salad.notes:
This recipe looks great served in a small footed bowl or an elegant dessert plate.
