directions.8: Allow the cake to cool in the baking pan on a wire rack for at least 10 minutes.
directions.9: Serve warm or at room temperature.

ingredients: 2 cans green beans, low-sodium (14.5 ounces each, drained)
Louisiana Green Beans.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Bell Peppers
Celery
Green Beans
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel and chop the onion.
directions.3: Chop the green pepper and celery.
directions.4: Drain the liquid from the green beans. Rinse with water.
directions.5: Put the green beans in a saucepan. Add enough water to cover them
directions.6: Cook the green beans on low heat until tender. Then drain off the water.
directions.7: Combine all the ingredients in a skillet.
directions.8: Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes, until the celery is tender and the food is hot.

Low Calorie Dressing.notes:
Learn more about:

Tomatoes
Lemons
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients.
directions.3: Store in refrigerator.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients in small container.
directions.3: Store covered in refrigerator and use within 1 week.

ingredients: 1 can great northern beans (15 ounce, rinsed and drained, low sodium)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Blend the beans and garlic in a blender, adding enough water for the desired consistency.
directions.3: Blend for 2 minutes to make it silky smooth.
directions.4: Use a spatula to scrape the mixture into a medium bowl.
directions.5: Stir in the yogurt, cayenne, chives, parsley, and tarragon, salt, and lemon juice. Serve in a bowl.

ingredients: 1/2 cup low-fat plain yogurt (or low-fat sour cream)
1 tablespoon onion, minced (or 2 teaspoons dried minced onion)
1 teaspoon dried parsley (or 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley)
Low-Fat Tartar Sauce.notes:
Try making with plain Greek yogurt.
Learn more about:

Onions
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a small bowl, combine all the ingredients.
directions.3: Serve immediately or cover and refrigerate until used.

ingredients: 1 bell pepper (green, red, yellow, or orange)
1 can beans, low-sodium (15.5 ounces, black, kidney, pinto or other, drained and rinsed)
2 cups macaroni (cooked, without salt or fat added or other pasta)
Mac and Beans Medley.notes:
Learn more about:

Garlic
Bell Peppers
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with warm water and soap.
directions.2: Peel and finely chop the garlic. Core, seed, and finely chop the bell pepper.
directions.3: Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and bell pepper. Cook for one minute. Do not let garlic brown. Add diced tomatoes (do not drain) and red pepper flakes.
directions.4: Cover the skillet and lower heat. Cook for 10 minutes or until sauce is slightly thickened.
directions.5: Add beans and cooked macaroni to skillet and cook 5 minutes or until heated through.
directions.6: Serve hot.

Macaroni & Cheese with Broccoli.notes:
Fresh or frozen broccoli can be used.
Learn more about:

Broccoli

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook macaroni, following the instructions on the package.
directions.3: Drain the cooked macaroni and return to the pan.
directions.4: While the macaroni is still warm, sprinkle in the flour and stir thoroughly.
directions.5: Over medium heat, slowly stir the milk into the macaroni.
directions.6: Add the cheese and pepper.
directions.7: Stir over medium heat until the milk and cheese thicken into a creamy sauce, approximately 7-10 minutes.
directions.8: Stir in the broccoli; heat thoroughly.
directions.9: Taste; add a small amount of salt, if needed.
directions.10: Refrigerate leftovers.

ingredients: 3 1/2 cups chicken broth, fat-free, low sodium
Macaroni Chick-Pea Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Herbs
Tomatoes
Green Beans

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large saucepan, bring broth and water to a boil. Reduce heat to low.
directions.3: Add macaroni, celery flakes, and oregano. Simmer 4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
directions.4: Add stewed tomatoes, green beans, chick-peas (drained), and garlic powder.
directions.5: Simmer 5 minutes, or until macaroni and beans are tender.

ingredients: 2 cups vegetables, frozen, no salt added (or use fresh or leftovers)
Magic Crust Quiche.notes:
Suggest preparing with frozen broccoli (shown) or spinach.
Learn more about:

Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook onion in oil (or cook with vegetables).
directions.3: Cook vegetables (or use leftovers). Drain well.
directions.4: Grease round pie pan or 8x8 inch baking dish.
directions.5: Spread cooked vegetables in pan. Spread cheese on top of vegetables.
directions.6: Mix milk, eggs, and baking mix. Pour over vegetables and cheese.
directions.7: Bake at 350 °F for 35 minutes, until a safe internal temperature has been reached and a knife inserted into the middle comes out clean.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine dry milk, flour, and salt in a large bowl.
directions.3: Cut in margarine with two knives until the mixture looks like cornmeal.
directions.4: Store in a dry, closed container in the refrigerator for up to 6 weeks.

ingredients: 1 can pineapple chunks, juice packed (20 ounce)
1 cup grapes, seedless -- red or green
1 package pudding mix, instant -- lemon or vanilla (3 1/2 ounce)
Magical Fruit Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Pineapples
Grapes
Bananas

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain off the juice. Put chunks in a large bowl.
directions.3: Rinse the grapes and drain. Add the grapes to the bowl.
directions.4: Peel the bananas and cut into bite-sized pieces. Add to the bowl.
directions.5: Pour the milk over the fruit. While slowly stirring the fruit mixture, sprinkle in the pudding mix.
directions.6: Let the mixture stand for 5 minutes and serve.
directions.7: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

ingredients: 3 cans kidney beans or garbanzo beans, low-sodium (15.5 ounce)
Main Dish Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Cabbage
Lettuce
Carrots
Cucumbers
Bell Peppers
Broccoli
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash and drain all vegetables well.
directions.3: Thickly slice red cabbage, tear lettuce into pieces, peel and grate (or slice) carrots and cucumber, cut broccoli into florets and tomato into wedges.
directions.4: Combine all salad ingredients in a bowl.
directions.5: Add salad dressing and toss together lightly just before serving.

ingredients: 1 cup (4 oz) whole-wheat rotini pasta, uncooked
Mango Berry Rotini Salad.notes:
Serving Suggestion: Serve with an 8 ounce glass of non-fat milk.
Learn more about:

Mangos
Raspberries
Blueberries
Spinach

directions.1: In a small bowl, whisk vinaigrette ingredients; set aside.
directions.2: Boil water and cook rotini according to package instructions. Drain cooked rotini and rinse in cool water.
directions.3: While rotini is cooking, cut mango into chunks, removing peel and pit.
directions.4: Place salad ingredients in a large bowl; drizzle with vinaigrette. Toss gently.

Mango Cucumber Soup.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with a glass of 100% apple juice.
Learn more about:

Mangos
Cucumbers
Onions
Limes
Herbs

directions.1: Cut all but one half of mango into chunks, removing peel and pit; chill remaining mango half for use with garnish.
directions.2: Slice off 1/4 of the cucumber and chill for use with garnish. Coarsely chop remaining 3/4 of the cucumber.
directions.3: Place chopped mango, cucumber, onion, and pepper (optional) in blender or food processor with lime juice and water. Purée until smooth.
directions.4: Blend in yogurt. Chill until ready to serve.
directions.5: About 15 to 30 minutes before serving, prepare garnish. Dice chilled mango half, removing peel and pit; dice remaining cucumber. Mix mango and cucumber dices with cilantro. To serve, top bowls of soup with garnish.

ingredients: 1 mango (peeled, pitted, and diced, or 1 cup thawed frozen chunks)
cilantro (1 tablespoon, optional, fresh or dried)
Mango Salsa.notes:
Learn more about:

Mangos
Onions
Herbs
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
directions.3: Serve with baked tortilla chips.

ingredients: 1 fresh pitted mango (or 4 Tablespoons of frozen mango juice)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put all ingredients into a blender.
directions.3: Blend until foamy.
directions.4: Serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 cans clams (6 1/2 ounces each, chopped, drained)
Manhattan Clam Chowder.notes:
Learn more about:

Celery
Onions
Tomatoes
Potatoes
Carrots
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Scrub potatoes well to remove any eyes or blemishes.
directions.3: In a slow cooker, combine all ingredients; stir.
directions.4: Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until the vegetables are tender.
directions.5: Remove bay leaf and peppercorns before serving.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Prick potato skins with a fork. Microwave on high for 3 to 4 minute until soft and easily pierced with a knife.
directions.3: Scoop out the pulp into a medium bowl.
directions.4: Mash the pulp and stir in the yogurt, maple syrup, and orange juice.
directions.5: Transfer to a microwave safe serving bowl and microwave for 1 to 2 minutes to heat through.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Using a cutting board and sharp knife, cut round steak across the grain into thin strips about 1/2 inch wide and 2 to 3 inches long.
directions.3: In a medium glass mixing bowl, combine garlic, lemon juice, 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil, salt, and pepper.
directions.4: Add beef strips and stir to coat with the oil mixture (marinade sauce). Cover bowl with plastic wrap and refrigerate for about 2 hours.
directions.5: In a medium skillet over medium-high heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil for 1-2 minutes until hot.
directions.6: Drain marinade from beef. Put beef in skillet, stir and cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until meat is thoroughly browned.

ingredients: 1/2 can cut green beans, low-sodium (8 ounce)
1/2 can red kidney beans, low-sodium (8 ounce)
Marinated Three-Bean Salad.notes:
Garnish with parsley if desired.
Learn more about:

Green Beans
Onions
Celery

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Drain the canned beans.
directions.3: Peel and chop the onion.
directions.4: In a large bowl, combine the cannellini beans, green beans, kidney beans, onion, and celery.
directions.5: Pour the Italian dressing over the vegetables and toss lightly.
directions.6: Cover the bowl and marinate in the refrigerator for at least one hour. The salad can be left in the refrigerator over night.
directions.7: Drain before serving.

Mashed Parsnips and Potatoes.notes:
Try other seasonings such as parsley, thyme or nutmeg.
Learn more about:

Parsnips
Potatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Scrub parsnips and potatoes under running water and peel.
directions.3: Cut into similar size pieces.
directions.4: In a medium saucepan, cover the vegetables pieces with cold water. Bring the water to a boil and simmer until vegetables are soft, 15 to 20 minutes.
directions.5: Drain the vegetables and mash. Stir in milk, salt, pepper, garlic powder and margarine. Serve hot.
directions.6: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

Mashed Sweet Potatoes.notes:
Learn more about:

Sweet Potatoes
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash and peel the potatoes. Cut them into slices that are 3/4 inch thick.
directions.3: Put them in a saucepan with enough water to cover the potatoes.
directions.4: Bring the water to a boil on medium heat.
directions.5: Cook the potatoes for 20 to 25 minutes until they’re soft.
directions.6: Drain the water. Put the potatoes in a medium bowl.
directions.7: Use a fork or potato masher to mash the potatoes.
directions.8: Mix in the thyme, salt, and pepper.

Mashed Taters.notes: Tip: Change the recipe by adding fresh onion, green pepper, blended American and skim cheese, or substitute chicken broth for a rich flavor with less fat. Remember that adding chicken broth will increase the sodium.

directions.1: Over medium to high heat, combine water and light buttery spread in a medium-sized pot, and bring it to a boil.
directions.2: Turn off heat; add potatoes and mix well.
directions.3: Add milk to potatoes and mix well. If using garlic powder, add that too.

Master Mix Oregon.notes: The final product of this recipe is intended to be used as an ingredient in other recipes. It is not intended as a ready-to-eat product.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large bowl combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, dry milk, baking powder, and salt.
directions.3: Mix thoroughly.
directions.4: Cut in shortening with pastry blender or two knives until mixture looks like course cornmeal.
directions.5: Store in covered containers in the refrigerator.

Masur Dal (Red Lentils with Onion).notes:
This is a very common food item in Bengali as well as in Indian communities. Generally, lunch or dinner is started with this item followed by two to three main courses. On special occasions, or when preparing this for someone special, one may garnish it with coconut flakes or cilantro leaves.
Learn more about:

Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Rinse the lentils in a strainer under running water two to three times.
directions.3: In a bowl, combine the washed lentils, 1 teaspoon oil, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
directions.4: Boil lentils in 1 1/2 cups water until they turn yellow and soft. Add turmeric powder, cumin powder, and sugar to the boiled lentils and mix them well.
directions.5: In a separate pan, add rest of the oil and allow it to heat.
directions.6: Split the chili peppers in half and add to the heated oil.
directions.7: Add onion to the oil and stir until it starts to turn light brown.
directions.8: Add 2 tablespoons boiled lentils (mixed with spices) into the fried onion and stir well for one minute.
directions.9: Add the rest of the boiled lentil mix and stir.
directions.10: Add 1 cup of water and allow it to boil for two minutes. Serve over white rice. Add parsley garnish if desired.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine eggs and sugar; beat well.
directions.3: Add milk and melted butter; mix well.
directions.4: Stir in matzo meal and salt.
directions.5: Pour into buttered 11x13 inch pan.
directions.6: Bake at 350 °F for 1 hour (don't over bake).
directions.7: Cut into slices. Can be served hot or cold.

ingredients: 3 bouillon cubes (low-sodium chicken or beef flavored, or 1 tablespoon low-sodium bouillon powder)
8 ounces ground beef (90% lean, or turkey or chicken)
2 cups vegetable mix (chopped, fresh, carrots, celery, and spinach)
Meatball Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Herbs
Tomatoes
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large pot, combine water, rice, bouillon cubes, and oregano. Bring to a boil over high heat.
directions.3: Stir to dissolve bouillon. Reduce heat to low and simmer.
directions.4: Meanwhile, in a large bowl, mix ground meat, tomato, onion, egg, and salt. Form into 12 meatballs.
directions.5: Add meatballs to broth mixture and simmer 30 minutes.
directions.6: Add vegetables. Cook 10 to 15 minutes or until meatballs are cooked and rice and vegetables are tender.
directions.7: Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 can (about 15 ounces) low-sodium cream style corn
Meatloaf.notes:
Tip for cooking ground beef: The recommended safe minimum internal temperature for ground beef is 160 °F, as measured with a food thermometer.
Learn more about:

Corn
Onions
Garlic

directions.1: Preheat oven to 375 °F.
directions.2: In a large pan, cook ground beef over medium heat for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain fat.
directions.3: Add corn, onions, and garlic to pan, and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
directions.4: Add water, cornmeal, egg mix, salt, and pepper to the beef mixture. Stir well and cook for 15 minutes.
directions.5: Use a large iron skillet or loaf pan. Spray pan with nonstick cooking spray. Form beef and cornmeal mixture into a loaf in a pan.
directions.6: Cover pan with an oven-safe lid or foil and bake for 35 to 40 minutes.

Meatloaf in a Mug.notes:
Cooking time will increase if more than one meat loaf is placed in the microwave at a time.
Leftover dry onion mix can be used as a seasoning for baked or microwaved vegetables.

Food Safety Note: Cook until the internal temperature is 160 °F when measured with a meat thermometer.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients and stir to mix.
directions.3: Spray microwave-safe mug with cooking spray.
directions.4: Pat beef mixture into mug. Make a small hold in center, all the way to the bottom.
directions.5: Microwave on HIGH (100%) for 3 minutes or until done.

ingredients: 8 ounces turkey, chicken, beef, or pork, diced and cooked
Meaty Stuffed Potatoes.notes:
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Broccoli
Onions
Carrots

directions.1: Wash your hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Scrub potatoes. Remove any bad spots. Do not peel. Cut each in half.
directions.3: In a covered saucepan, boil potatoes in just enough water to cover the pieces. When they are fork-tender (about 15 to 20 minutes), remove from heat and drain. Set aside. (Note: you can also pierce whole potatoes with a knife or fork in several places and cook in microwave without water until fork tender, then cut each in half).
directions.4: Meanwhile, in a skillet sprayed with non-stick cooking spray, combine cooked meat, broccoli, onion, carrots and water.
directions.5: Boil until vegetables are fork tender - about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to low.
directions.6: In a jar with a tight fitting lid, combine milk, flour and pepper. Shake well.
directions.7: Stir flour mixture into meat mixture until well blended.
directions.8: Stir in cheese. Cook over low heat about 5 minutes longer or until sauce thickens, stirring frequently.
directions.9: To serve, place 2 potato halves on each plate and mash the middle somewhat. Spoon about one third cup of the meat mixture over each potato half
directions.10: Cover and refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

ingredients: 1 cup skinless cooked chicken (diced into 1/2 inch pieces)
1 can 15.5 ounce low-sodium white beans (drained and rinsed with cold water)
1 cucumber (peeled and diced into 1/2 inch pieces)
1/4 red or white onion (peeled and chopped into 1/2 inch pieces)
1 tablespoon dried basil or parsley leaves
Mediterranean Chicken and White Bean Sal.notes:
2 (5-ounce) cans of tuna in water can be used instead of chicken.
Great Northern, chickpeas, cannellini, or navy beans can be used.
Add 1/2 cup chopped fresh tomatoes.

Learn more about:

Cucumbers
Onions
Lemons
Herbs

directions.1: Put everything in the bowl and gently toss.
directions.2: Serve right away, or cover and refrigerate for up to 2 days.

ingredients: 1 cup pizza sauce (low-sodium, or low-sodium spaghetti sauce)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Wash and remove the stem end, and slice the eggplants into 1/2-inch slices.
directions.4: Spray a baking pan with vegetable oil spray and lay the eggplant in the pan in a single layer.
directions.5: Spoon low-sodium pizza or spaghetti sauce on each slice.
directions.6: Bake 30 minutes in the preheated oven.
directions.7: Stir the yogurt and garlic together.
directions.8: Drizzle the sauce in thin lines on each of the eggplant slices before serving. You can do this easily by putting the sauce in a plastic squirt bottle or using a spoon.
directions.9: Serve immediately as an entrée or side dish.

Melissa\u2019s Slow Cooker Stuffing.notes:
Learn more about:

Celery
Onions
Herbs
Mushrooms
Cranberries
Apples

directions.1: Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Add onion, celery, mushrooms, and parsley to pan. Stir often until veggies are tender.
directions.2: Combine bread cubes, cranberries, and apple in a large bowl. Pour veggies over bread cubes and mix gently.
directions.3: Season with poultry seasoning, sage, thyme, garlic powder, and pepper. Pour in broth (just enough to moisten) and gently mix in eggs.
directions.4: Transfer mixture to slow cooker and cover.
directions.5: Set slow cooker to High for 45 minutes; then reduce heat to Low and cook for 4 to 8 hours.

Melon and Mint.notes:
Try with other types of melon such as cantaloupe or crenshaw melons.
Try omitting the brown sugar and adding crumbled feta cheese.

Learn more about:

Limes
Herbs
Watermelon
Honeydew Melon

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Blend lime juice, mint leaves, and brown sugar together in a small food processor.
directions.3: Place melon cubes in a bowl. Drizzle dressing over melon and toss gently.

ingredients: 2 cups melon, honeydew, cantaloupe, or watermelon, fresh (seeded and chopped, use one kind or a combination)
cilantro or mint, fresh (2 tablespoon, chopped, optional)
1/2 jalapeño (seeded and finely chopped, or hot sauce to taste)
1/4 cup lime juice or lemon juice
Melon Salsa.notes:
Caution: When handling hot peppers, the oils can cause burning and skin irritation. You can wear clean kitchen gloves or wash hands thoroughly after preparing. KEEP HANDS AWAY FROM EYES.
Learn more about:

Watermelon
Cantaloupe
Honeydew Melon
Cucumbers
Onions
Herbs
Limes
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a medium size bowl, stir together all ingredients.
directions.3: Taste and season with more lemon or lime juice, sugar if needed.
directions.4: Cover and chill for at least 30 minutes. Serve with grilled or broiled fish or chicken.

Microwave Baked Apple.notes:
One pound apples = 3 medium apples = 3 cups sliced apples. This is good information to know at the grocery store.
Favorite varieties of apples for baking are Jonathan, Granny Smith, Braeburn, and Golden Delicious. Any tart apple works well.
Arrange the apples around the outside edge of the dish for more even cooking in the microwave.
Safety Tips: Wash the apples in clear running water before coring. If you have apples left, keep in the fridge for a handy snack later on.

Learn more about:

Apples

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash apples and remove core.
directions.3: Cut a thin slice off bottom of each apple to form a flat surface. Place apples in a microwave-safe baking dish.
directions.4: Mix brown sugar and cinnamon in a small dish. Spoon mixture into center of apples.
directions.5: Cover wax paper and microwave on high power 6 to 10 minutes or until apples are soft.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Scrub potato. Prick several times with a fork or knife.
directions.3: Place on microwave-safe plate.
directions.4: Cook according to table above.
directions.5: Turn halfway through cooking.
directions.6: Let potato rest for 1 to 3 minutes
directions.7: Add seasonings and toppings as desired.

Microwave Cauliflower and Peas in Cream.notes:
Options: Vegetables may be boiled or steamed and sauce prepared on top of a range if a microwave is not available.
Variations: Use other combinations of vegetables, such as green beans and cauliflower; broccoli and carrots; or peas and carrots.
Add lime as a garnish if desired.
Learn more about:

Onions
Herbs
Cauliflower
Peas
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine cauliflower, peas, and water in a 1-quart casserole. Cover. Microwave at High 6 to 8 minutes, or until fork-tender, stirring after half the time. Let stand, covered.
directions.3: Place onion and butter or margarine in 2-cup measure. Microwave at High 1 to 1 1/2 minutes, or until onion is tender.
directions.4: Stir in flour. Microwave a few seconds until flour mixture starts to bubble.
directions.5: Add remaining ingredients. Microwave at High 1 1/2 to 2 minutes, or until thickened, stirring every minute.
directions.6: Drain vegetables. (Freeze drained liquid for use in soups later.) Pour sauce over vegetables and stir to coat.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons red or green bell peppers (chopped)
1 slider-sized bun or whole wheat English muffin (split and toasted)
Microwave Denver Scramble Slider.notes:
Don't overcook. Scrambled eggs will continue to cook and firm up after removed from microwave.
Microwave ovens vary. Cook time may need to be adjusted.

Learn more about:

Bell Peppers
Onions

directions.1: Place peppers and onions in 8 ounce ramekin or custard cup, or in a small bowl. Microwave on high 30 seconds; stir. Add egg, ham, and water, beat until egg is blended.
directions.2: Microwave on high 30 seconds; stir. Microwave until egg is almost set, 30 to 45 seconds longer. Season with salt and pepper, if desired.
directions.3: Serve in bun.

Microwave Potato Corn Chowder.notes:
Shredded cheese, crumbled bacon, chopped ham, or onion may be added. Add clams for clam chowder.
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Corn

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Melt margarine in glass bowl on HIGH for 30 to 50 seconds.
directions.3: Stir in flour, salt and pepper until smooth.
directions.4: Blend milk into flour-margarine mixture.
directions.5: Cook on HIGH for 6 to 8 minutes, until thickened, stirring well each minute. Set aside.
directions.6: In a separate microwave safe bowl, cook 2 potatoes in 1 cup water. When potatoes are done add potatoes and cooking water to white sauce.
directions.7: Stir in one 16 ounce can of corn. Cook 2 to 3 minutes or until steaming hot.

Migas \"Crumbs\".notes:
Learn more about:

Bell Peppers
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Tear tortillas into small pieces.
directions.3: Heat oil in a medium-sized pan.
directions.4: Add tortillas and stir until pieces begin to brown.
directions.5: Add peppers and onion; sauté until soft.
directions.6: Add eggs; stir until the eggs are cooked.
directions.7: Remove from heat and sprinkle on the grated cheese.
directions.8: Cover the pan and let cheese melt.
directions.9: Serve immediately.

ingredients: 2 cans stewed tomatoes, canned, low-sodium (14.5 ounce)
2 cans broth, any flavor, canned, low-sodium (14 ounce cans)
1 can beans, canned, any type, low-sodium (15.5 ounce)
1 ounce pasta, dry, any type (1 cup)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Adult and child: Wash hands well with soap and hot water.
directions.3: Child: In a large pot, combine frozen vegetables, tomatoes, broth and beans.
directions.4: Adult: Bring the soup to a boil and add the pasta. Then reduce to low heat. Let simmer for 6 to 8 minutes or until the pasta and vegetables are tender.

ingredients: 1 teaspoon olive oil (or other vegetable oil)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Slice string cheese into 4 equal parts.
directions.3: On a toothpick, skewer one cherry tomato, 2 basil leaves, and 1 piece string cheese.
directions.4: Drizzle finished kebabs evenly with olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

ingredients: 1 can mandarin oranges, drained (in light syrup)
Mixed Fruit Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Oranges
Pineapples
Apples
Bananas

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix all ingredients together.
directions.3: Cover and chill until ready to serve.
directions.4: Refrigerate leftovers.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix cornmeal, brown sugar, salt and oil with boiling water, cool to lukewarm (105 to 115 °F).
directions.3: Dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup warm water; stir into cornmeal mixture. Add whole wheat and rye flours and mix well. Stir in enough all purpose flour to make dough stiff enough to knead.
directions.4: Turn dough onto lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 to 10 minutes.
directions.5: Place dough in lightly oiled bowl, turning oil top. Cover with clean towel; let rise in warm place until double, about 1 hour.
directions.6: Punch dough down; turn onto clean surface. Cover with clean towel; let rest 10 minutes. Shape dough and place in greased 9x5 inch pan. Cover with clean towel; let rise until almost double, about 1 hour.
directions.7: Preheat oven to 375 °F. Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until bread sounds hollow when tapped. Cover with aluminum foil during baking if bread is browning too quickly. Remove bread from pan and cool on wire rack.

ingredients: 1 cup cottage cheese, low-fat or non-fat

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all in the blender and blend until smooth.

ingredients: 3 cups sweet potatoes, cooked, skin removed and mashed

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place milk, sugar, vanilla, and banana in blender. Process 15 seconds at high speed until smooth.
directions.3: Pour mixture into a small bowl; fold in yogurt. Chill. Spoon into four dessert dishes; garnish each with two banana slices just before serving.

ingredients: 1/2 cup corn flakes (crumbled or regular bread crumbs)
Mouth-Watering Oven-Fried Fish.notes:
Atlantic cod and low fat buttermilk (1%) used for nutritional analysis.
May substitute black pepper for white pepper.
Optional - add parsley as a garnish.

Learn more about:

Lemons
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 475 °F.
directions.3: Clean and rinse fish. Wipe fillets with lemon juice and pat dry.
directions.4: Combine milk, hot sauce, and garlic.
directions.5: Combine pepper, salt, and onion powder with crumbs and place on plate.
directions.6: Let fillets sit briefly in milk. Remove and coat fillets on both sides with seasoned crumbs. Let stand briefly until coating sticks to each side of fish.
directions.7: Arrange on lightly oiled shallow baking dish.
directions.8: Bake for 20 minutes on middle rack without turning.
directions.9: Cut into 6 pieces. Serve with fresh lemon.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Line a baking sheet with foil and spray lightly with cooking spray.
directions.4: Remove cheese from package and cut into bite size pieces.
directions.5: In a small non-stick skillet mix oregano and basil with bread crumbs.
directions.6: Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally until crumbs are lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
directions.7: Dip each piece of cheese in milk and then into toasted bread crumbs, coating completely.
directions.8: Place on baking sheet about 1 1/2 inches apart.
directions.9: Spray string cheese lightly with non-stick cooking spray.
directions.10: Bake 5 to 6 minutes or until heated through. (Cheese may melt slightly and lose shape. Simply press it back into place).
directions.11: Dip in warmed marinara sauce and enjoy.

ingredients: 8 chicken breast halves (small, skin and bone removed)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Place chicken between 2 sheets of plastic wrap; pound chicken to 1/4 inch thick.
directions.4: Coat chicken with bread crumbs and place on foil-covered baking sheet. Discard remaining bread crumbs. Bake 10 minutes.
directions.5: Top chicken with cheese; bake 4 to 5 minutes until cheese is melted and chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165 °F.
directions.6: Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet on medium heat. Add garlic and stir 1 minute.
directions.7: Add half the spinach and cook 1 minute.
directions.8: Add remaining spinach. Cook until wilted, turning occasionally. Serve with chicken.

ingredients: 2 Servings of Better Baking Mix (2 cups)
Muffins (from Better Baking Mix).notes:
Blueberry muffins: Gently stir 1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries into batter.
Apple muffins: Add 1 teaspoon cinnamon to the dry ingredients. Reduce water to 1/2 cup. At the end of mixing, gently stir in 1 cup finely chopped fresh apples.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Grease 12-cup muffin pan.
directions.4: Mix the Better Baking Mix and sugar in a bowl.
directions.5: Beat the egg with a fork.
directions.6: Add egg, oil, and water to dry ingredients. Stir just until all ingredients are wet.
directions.7: Spoon into the prepared muffin pan.

Mushroom Barley Soup.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Celery
Carrots
Potatoes
Mushrooms
Garlic
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat oil in large soup pot over high heat. Sauté onion, celery, carrots, and mushrooms until golden, about 4 minutes.
directions.3: Add the rest of the ingredients except for the parsley and bring to a boil.
directions.4: Lower heat to a simmer and cook until the barley is tender, about 20 minutes.
directions.5: Sprinkle parsley on top of soup and serve hot.

Mushroom Beef Sloppy Joes.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with a glass of non-fat milk and a slice of watermelon.
Learn more about:

Mushrooms
Onions
Garlic
Tomatoes

directions.1: Chop mushrooms to approximate size and texture of cooked ground beef.
directions.2: Heat a sauté pan over medium-high heat.
directions.3: Add ground beef and mushrooms, and cook.
directions.4: Sauté until ground beef is done.
directions.5: Remove mushroom-beef mixture from pan.
directions.6: Add onions and garlic to pan; cook until golden.
directions.7: Return mushroom-beef mixture to pan, along with remaining ingredients.
directions.8: Simmer about 10 minutes; remove from heat.

ingredients: 12 ounces sirloin or other boneless steak (about 3/4-inch thick)
1 medium red bell pepper (sliced into strips)
1 medium yellow bell pepper (sliced into strips)
Mushroom Steak Fajitas.notes:
Serving Suggestions: Serve with a glass of non-fat milk and side of mango chunks.
Learn more about:

Mushrooms
Bell Peppers
Tomatoes
Lettuce

directions.1: Slice beef across the grain into 1/4-inch strips. Place in a medium bowl with 1/2 tablespoon fiesta lime seasoning; toss to coat.
directions.2: Place mushrooms, peppers, and onion and remaining fiesta lime seasoning in a large bowl; toss to coat.
directions.3: Heat oil in large, non-stick skillet. Add beef strips; cook about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from skillet.
directions.4: Place coated vegetables in skillet and sauté until vegetables are slightly tender, about 5 to 8 minutes.
directions.5: Add beef back to skillet and sauté mixture 1 to 2 more minutes.
directions.6: Assemble fajitas by dividing beef-vegetable mixture evenly on each tortilla, top with remaining ingredients and roll up.

ingredients: 1 packet of yeast, active dry (1/4 ounce)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water and let stand about 10 minutes, or until frothy.
directions.3: Stir in sugar, milk, egg, salt, and enough flour to make a soft dough.
directions.4: Knead for 6 to 8 minutes on a lightly floured surface or until smooth.
directions.5: Let it rise 1 hour until the dough has doubled in volume.
directions.6: Punch down dough and knead in garlic.
directions.7: Pinch off small handfuls of dough about the size of a golf ball.
directions.8: Roll into balls and place on a tray.
directions.9: Cover with a towel and allow to rise until doubled in size, about 30 minutes.
directions.10: During the second rising, preheat grill to high heat.
directions.11: At grill side, roll one ball of dough out into a thin circle.
directions.12: Lightly oil grill. Place dough on grill and cook for two to three minutes or until puffy and lightly browned.
directions.13: Brush uncooked side with butter and turn over.
directions.14: Brush cooked side with butter and cook until browned, another 2 to 4 minutes.
directions.15: Remove from grill and continue the process until all the naan has been prepared.

ingredients: 1 can no salt added diced tomatoes (14.5 oz. can)
5 ounces canned tuna, packed in water, drained
1/4 cup sliced ripe olives, drained (or 1-2.2 ounce can)
Salt and ground pepper to taste

directions.1: Cook fettuccine as label directs. Reserve 1 cup cooking liquid; drain.
directions.2: Meanwhile, in 10-inch skillet over medium heat, in hot oil, cook onion and garlic, about 5 minutes until just softened. Add diced tomatoes and capers; simmer 5 minutes. Add tuna, olives, salt, and pepper to taste.
directions.3: Toss fettuccine with tuna mixture to mix well. Serve immediately. If necessary, add reserved cooking liquid.

New Orleans Red Beans.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Celery
Herbs
Bell Peppers
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Pick through beans to remove bad beans; rinse thoroughly.
directions.3: In a large pot combine beans, water, onion, celery, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil; reduce heat. Cover and cook over low heat for about 1-1/2 hours until beans are tender. Stir. Mash beans against side of pan.
directions.4: Add green pepper, garlic, parsley, thyme, salt, and black pepper. Cook, uncovered, over low heat until creamy (about 30 minutes). Remove bay leaves.
directions.5: Serve with hot cooked brown rice, if desired.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat honey and peanut butter in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir until blended.
directions.3: Remove from heat. Stir in dry milk.
directions.4: Fold in cereal and raisins. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto waxed paper to form mounds.
directions.5: Cool to room temperature. Store in refrigerator.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In large sauce pan, bring the first six ingredients to a full, rolling boil for 1 minute, stirring as needed.
directions.3: Remove from heat. Add oats, dry milk, and raisins and vanilla to boiled mixture.
directions.4: Mix well.
directions.5: Drop by tablespoons onto waxed paper and let stand until cool, about 15 to 20 minutes.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons raisins, dates, or other dried fruit
Oat Bran Muffins.notes:
Learn more about:

Bananas
Apples
Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 425 °F.
directions.3: Mix the first four dry ingredients. Set aside. Mix the egg with orange juice, milk, and oil. Mix fruit and blend with dry ingredients.
directions.4: Add the liquid ingredients to the dry until it is moist.
directions.5: Spray muffin tin with a non-stick coating. Pour batter into muffin tins.
directions.6: Bake for 15 to 17 minutes. Remove muffins from pan after 10 minutes. Cool on a rack. Freeze muffins for later use.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 375 °F. Mix together oatmeal, flour, sugar, baking soda, salt, and cinnamon in a large bowl.
directions.3: Cut in margarine until mixture resembles coarse meal.
directions.4: Combine oil, vanilla, egg whites, and water. Stir into dry ingredients and raisins, mixing only until it holds together.
directions.5: Wash hands thoroughly, then dip in cornmeal or flour. Pinch off pieces of dough and form into balls about 1 inch in diameter.
directions.6: Place balls on baking pan (sprayed with non-stick cooking spray) and press out slightly to about 1/4 inch in thickness.
directions.7: Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool, then store in an airtight container.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine rolled oats and salt in a large mixing bowl. Stir in boiling water; cool to lukewarm (105 to 115 °F).
directions.3: Dissolve yeast in 1/4 cup warm water in small bowl.
directions.4: Add yeast water, molasses, and oil to cooled oatmeal mixture. Stir in whole wheat flour and 1 cup all purpose flour. Add additional all purpose flour to make a dough stiff enough to knead.
directions.5: Knead dough on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes.
directions.6: Place dough in lightly oiled bowl, turning to oil top. Cover with clean towel; let rise in warm place until double, about 1 hour.
directions.7: Punch dough down; turn onto clean surface. Shape dough and place in greased 9x5 inch pan. Cover with clean towel; let rise in a warm place until almost double, about 1 hour.
directions.8: Preheat oven to 375 °F. Bake 50 minutes or until bread sounds hollow when tapped. Cover with aluminum foil during baking if bread is browning too quickly. Remove bread from pan and cool on wire rack.

ingredients: 1 teaspoon margarine or butter (to grease the muffin cups)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Put the egg, milk, and oil in a small mixing bowl. Slowly stir them together.
directions.4: In a large mixing bowl, mix the flour, oatmeal, sugar, baking powder, salt, and raisins. Stir until they are mixed.
directions.5: Pour the egg-milk-oil mix into the large bowl with the dry ingredients.
directions.6: Stir until the dry ingredients are barely moistened. Do not over-mix (the batter should be lumpy).
directions.7: Grease each cup in the muffin pans with some margarine or butter.
directions.8: Spoon the batter into the cups in each muffin pan, until each cup is half-full with batter.
directions.9: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the muffins are golden brown.

Okra and Greens.notes:
You can substitute about 2 cups of cut/frozen okra in place of whole okra. 
Learn more about:

Onions
Greens
Okra
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large heavy pan sauté onions in oil until golden brown.
directions.3: Add remaining ingredients and about 1/4 cup of water. Simmer over low heat, covered, until greens are tender.
directions.4: Squeeze on lemon juice before serving.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Spread one side of bread with margarine or butter. Sprinkle with cinnamon.
directions.3: Cut into 1-inch cubes.
directions.4: In lightly sprayed casserole dish, combine bread, sugar, and raisins. Then follow microwave or oven method below.

ingredients: 3 cups broth, chicken or turkey, low-sodium
Old Fashioned Dressing.notes:
Learn more about:

Celery
Onions
Herbs
Mushrooms

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Toast bread cubes and set aside for later use.
directions.3: Melt margarine or butter in medium size fry pan.
directions.4: Add celery and onion; cook until tender, about 10 minutes.
directions.5: Add parsley, mushrooms, seasoning, and broth. Cook for 5 minutes.
directions.6: Remove from heat and add the toasted bread cubes. Cover and let stand 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
directions.7: Refrigerate leftovers within 2 hours.

ingredients: 4 potatoes (medium, cut into 3/4 in cubes, microwaved 8-10 minutes until tender, or cooked on the top of the stove about 15 minutes until tender)
16 ounces chicken breasts, boned and skinned (cut into 3/4 inch cubes)
1 can whole kernel corn, low-sodium (15 ounce, drained)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook potatoes as directed.
directions.3: In a large skillet, brown chicken in oil on high for 5 minutes.
directions.4: Add potatotes; cook until potatoes are lightly browned.
directions.5: Add salsa and corn. Cook until heated through.

One Pan Spaghetti.notes:
For 16 ounces of broken spaghetti noodles, use about 1/3 of a one pound box.
Learn more about:

Onions
Tomatoes
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Brown meat and onions in a large skillet over medium-high heat (300 °F in an electric skillet). Drain fat.
directions.3: Stir in water, tomato sauce, and spices; bring to a boil.
directions.4: Add spaghetti, cover pan, and simmer 10 to 15 minutes, stirring often to prevent sticking.
directions.5: When spaghetti is tender, top with grated cheese.
directions.6: Refrigerate leftovers with in 2 hours.

ingredients: 1 pound ground turkey, 85% lean (or ground beef)
2 cans tomatoes and green chiles (10 ounce cans)
One Pan Taco Rice.notes:
Low-fat cheddar cheese used for nutritional analysis and costing.
Learn more about:

Onions
Tomatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a large skillet or pot, brown ground turkey and cook onion. When done, use paper towel to soak up any grease.
directions.3: Add remaining ingredients except cheese and mix together.
directions.4: Heat until very hot.
directions.5: Top with cheese before serving.

ingredients: 3 red potatoes or your favorite potato variety (about 1 pound)
2 red apples (Fuji, Pink Lady, Honeycrisp, Gala, etc.)
One-Dish Roasted Potatoes and Apples wit.notes:
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Apples
Onions

directions.1: Preheat oven to 425 °F.
directions.2: Cut potatoes into chunks, place in 2-quart baking dish.
directions.3: Drizzle with canola oil. Toss to coat.
directions.4: Roast potatoes in oven for about 20 minutes.
directions.5: While potatoes are roasting, cut apples and onions into chunks, and sausage into 1/2-inch slices.
directions.6: Remove baking dish from oven and reduce heat to 375 °F. Add all remaining ingredients to baking dish and toss.
directions.7: Return baking dish to oven and roast an additional 30 minutes until apples and potatoes are tender.

ingredients: 1 cup vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, carrots, green beans) (chopped)
1 cup pineapple chunks, drained (canned in juice, or fresh orange segments)
Oprah's Outtasight Salad.notes:
Tomatoes used in nutrition and cost analysis for vegetables.
Learn more about:

Lettuce
Spinach
Tomatoes
Cucumbers
Carrots
Green Beans
Pineapples

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put mixed salad greens on a large platter or in a salad bowl.
directions.3: In a large bowl, mix chopped vegetables and pineapple or orange segments.
directions.4: Add dressing and stir.
directions.5: Spoon mixture over salad greens.
directions.6: Top with raisins and nuts. Serve.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put all ingredients in a blender and mix well.
directions.3: Add more liquid if you want the drink thinner.

Orange Cow.notes:
Substitute 1 cup milk and 1 cup water for 2 cups water and 1/3 cup nonfat dry milk.
Learn more about:

Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Place all ingredients in blender or food processor.
directions.3: Secure lid and blend until smooth. Serve immediately.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water
directions.2: Blend at high speed in blender until frothy.

Orange Glazed Skinless Chicken Wings.notes: Leg pieces or whole chicken may be prepared this way and served as an entrée.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Rinse chicken wings and dry on paper toweling. Tuck the wing tip under the larger joint to form a triangle.
directions.3: Heat butter in skillet (200 °F on temperature controlled gas burner).
directions.4: Sprinkle wings with seasoned salt and place in heated butter. Sauté on temperature controlled gas burner (325 °F) until evenly brown on both sides, about 20 minutes.
directions.5: Spread with orange marmalade, continuing to sauté while basting frequently for another 20 minutes.
directions.6: Remove from skillet. Serve hot.
directions.7: Hold at serving temperature on automatic burner or in 'Keep-Warm' oven set at 170 °F. They will be glazed and "sticky" good.

Orange Honeyed Acorn Squash.notes:
Learn more about:

Winter Squash
Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 400 °F.
directions.3: Cut squash in half. Remove seeds and place halves in shallow baking pan.
directions.4: Combine orange juice and honey. Mix well. Put some of the orange juice/honey mixture in each squash cavity.
directions.5: Add 1 tablespoon of the margarine to each squash half. Sprinkle with nutmeg, if desired.
directions.6: Cover pan with aluminum foil to keep steam in and speed cooking.
directions.7: Bake 30 minutes. Remove foil and continue baking 30 minutes more, or until squash is tender.

Orange Pork Chops.notes:
Learn more about:

Sweet Potatoes
Oranges

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: In a medium skillet, brown pork chops in a small amount of oil.
directions.4: Cut sweet potato into 1/2-inch slices.
directions.5: Place meat and sweet potato slices in a baking dish and top with orange slices; sprinkle with seasonings if desired.
directions.6: Cover and bake for 1 hour until meat is tender.
directions.7: Cook pork to 145 °F.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Wash and peel sweet potatoes. Cut into 1/4 inch slices.
directions.3: In a large bowl, toss slices in olive oil until coated. Sprinkle with salt and pepper if desired.
directions.4: Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet.
directions.5: Bake at 425 °F until tender and golden brown (about 20 minutes), turning occasionally to brown evenly.

ingredients: 1 pound tilapia fillets, fresh or thawed (4 fillets)
Oven Fried Fish.notes:
Instead of bread crumbs, 1/2 cup crushed, unsweetened cereal or 1/2 cup crushed saltine crackers can be used.
Learn more about:

Lemons
Limes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: In a small bowl, add egg, salt (if desired), and pepper and beat together.
directions.4: Place the bread crumbs in a separate bowl. Dip fish fillets in the egg mixture, then dip in the bread crumbs to coat.
directions.5: Melt butter in a shallow 9x13 inch baking pan for 1 minute in the oven. Tilt pan to coat with butter.
directions.6: Arrange fish fillets in the pan.
directions.7: Bake uncovered for 15 to 20 minutes, until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve topped with lime or lemon slices (optional).

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Italian dressing, low-fat (or olive oil)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: If chicken is frozen, thaw in the refrigerator 24 hours before cooking.
directions.3: Place chicken on a pan or plate while thawing in the refrigerator.
directions.4: Preheat oven to 375 °F.
directions.5: Remove necks and giblets from chicken cavity, if present before cooking. Reserve for another use.
directions.6: Place chicken, breast side up, in a roasting pan.
directions.7: Brush chicken skin with Italian dressing and sprinkle with garlic salt.
directions.8: Stuff lemon or orange into chicken cavity.
directions.9: Roast 1 1/4 to 1 1/2 hours or until meat thermometer inserted into chicken thigh registers 165 °F.
directions.10: Let chicken set for 15 minutes after removing from the oven before carving.

ingredients: 3 tablespoons whole wheat flour (or all-purpose flour)
2 russet potatoes, large (or 1 pound Yukon Gold potatoes)
applesauce and yogurt (plain low-fat or Greek) (optional)
Oven-Baked Potato Pancakes.notes:
These Hanukkah favorites are traditionally fried in oil to celebrate the oil of the eight nights of lights (like a menorah, which is a special Hanukkah candle holder, does). Our potato pancakes are actually oven-baked, which makes them easier, crunchier, and healthier.
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Onions

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Turn the oven on to bake and set it to 425 °F. Lightly oil the baking sheet (or sheets) by spreading the oil around with your clean hand or a paper towel.
directions.3: Put the flour, baking powder, and salt in a small bowl and mix well.
directions.4: Use the large holes on your grater to grate the potato, then grate the onion too.
directions.5: Put the potato and onion mixture in the colander inside the sink. Using a paper towel, press the potato mixture down to squeeze out and blot up some of the extra moisture. Stir it and blot again.
directions.6: Put the potato mixture in the large bowl, add the egg, and stir well. Add the flour mixture and stir it very well.
directions.7: Use a spoon or your fingers to pluck a clump of the potato mixture from the bowl and spread it into a round, flat nest on the oiled baking sheet: it should make a circle that's about 3 inches wide and 1/4 inch thick. Repeat to fill the sheet. (You don't need to leave space between them.)
directions.8: Bake until the bottoms are deeply golden, 15 to 20 minutes, then turn the pancakes over and back for 10 more minutes. Serve the latkes with applesauce and yogurt (optional).

ingredients: 1 pound yucca (cassava) cut into 3-inch sections and peeled (or 1 pound peeled frozen yucca)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a kettle, combine the yucca with enough cold water to cover it by 1 inch. Bring the water to a boil, and slowly simmer the yucca for 20 to 30 minutes, or until it is tender.
directions.3: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.4: Transfer the yucca with a slotted spoon to a cutting board. Let it cool and cut it lengthwise into 3/4-inch wide wedges, discarding the thin woody core.
directions.5: Spray cookie sheet with the nonstick cooking oil spray. Spread yucca wedges on cookie sheet and spray wedges with cooking oil spray. Cover with foil paper and bake for 8 minutes. Uncover and return to oven to bake for an additional 7 minutes.

ingredients: 3 cups fresh vegetables (cut up, such as potatoes, broccoli, carrots, cauliflower, or red peppers)
Oven-Roasted Vegetables.notes:
Learn more about:

Potatoes
Broccoli
Carrots
Cauliflower
Red Peppers

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 450 °F.
directions.3: In a small bowl, mix the oil, lemon juice, herbs, salt, and pepper.
directions.4: Wash, peel, and cut the fresh vegetables to get 3 cups cut-up vegetables.
directions.5: Spread vegetables on baking sheet pan.
directions.6: Pour the oil mixture over the vegetables and mix together.
directions.7: Bake for 20 minutes. Stir after the first 10 minutes of baking.
directions.8: Serve the vegetables while they are still hot.

ingredients: 1/2 cup dried fruit (raisins, cranberries or apricots)
Overnight Oatmeal.notes:
1/2 cup raisins and 1/4 cup walnuts used in nutrient analysis and costing.
Learn more about:

Grapes
Cranberries
Apricots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put all ingredients in a cooking pot and cover. Let sit overnight in refrigerator.
directions.3: In the morning, put on a stove burner and cook on medium heat until simmering, then turn on low and heat for 10 to 15 minutes more or less depending on type of oats -- quick (5 minutes), regular, or steel cut.
directions.4: Serve warm with a little milk (or milk alternative), a drizzle of maple syrup, and a side of fresh fruit, if desired.

ingredients: 1/2 cup low-fat milk (or less for thicker oatmeal)
Overnight Oatmeal with Berries.notes:
Frozen blueberries or strawberries may be used in place of raspberries.
Learn more about:

Raspberries
Blueberries
Strawberries

directions.1: Combine milk, Greek yogurt, sugar, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a container or jar with a lid.
directions.2: Add oats and mix well.
directions.3: Gently fold in raspberries.
directions.4: Cover and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight.
directions.5: Enjoy cold or heat as desired.

ingredients: 1/2 cup yellow onion (peeled and finely chopped)
4 tilapia fillets (patted dry with a paper towel, any inexpensive white fish can be used)
Pan Roasted Tilapia with Tomatillo Salsa.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Limes
Herbs

directions.1: To prepare the tomatillos, peel back the husk from the smooth green tomatillo skin. Rinse the tomatillos with warm water and cut into quarters. (Canned tomatillo salsa can be used instead of fresh.)
directions.2: Place the husked tomatillos, onion, chilies, garlic, and 1 teaspoon oil in the baking pan, stir well and transfer to the oven. Roast about 20 minutes until the tomatillos are soft and dark green. Set aside to cool.
directions.3: Transfer the mixture to the blender; add the salt, lime juice, and cilantro. Purée.

ingredients: 2 Servings of Better Baking Mix (2 cups)
Pancakes (from Better Baking Mix).notes: Try applesauce or other fruit on pancakes instead of syrup.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put all the ingredients in a bowl.
directions.3: Stir just enough to moisten dry ingredients.
directions.4: Preheat skillet on medium-high heat. The skillet is ready when drops of water "dance" on the dry surface. Add a teaspoon of vegetable oil or use cooking oil spray. For each pancake, pour 3 to 4 tablespoons of batter onto hot skillet.
directions.5: Cook slowly until the surface is covered with bubbles. Turn and cook until second side is lightly browned.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Melt butter or margarine in a heavy saucepan or skillet.
directions.3: Add cabbage and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add water.
directions.4: Cover pan with a tight-fitting lid to hold in steam.
directions.5: Cook over low heat until cabbage is tender (6 to 8 minutes), stirring occasionally to prevent sticking.
directions.6: Add lemon juice and serve.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.
directions.3: Stir together to mix well. Do not over mix.
directions.4: Turn out onto a floured board. Roll to a 1-inch thick square.
directions.5: Cut into 12 squares. Bake on a cookie sheet, spaced slightly apart, in a 400° F oven for 12 to 15 minutes.

ingredients: 2 (15 ounce) cans of peas, drained and rinsed (or 16 ounces frozen peas)
Parmesan Peas.notes:
Try other types of cheese or a blend!
Freeze extra lemon juice to use later.

Learn more about:

Peas
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat margarine or butter in a medium skillet over medium heat (300 °F in an electric skillet). Add peas and cook 2 to 3 minutes or until peas are heated through.
directions.3: Add lemon juice and pepper and mix well. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve warm.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a food processor, combine the almonds, cheese, parsley, and lemon juice.
directions.3: Slowly pour in oil and mix it into the rest of the ingredients.
directions.4: Season with salt and pepper.

ingredients: 3 cloves cloves garlic (chopped or 3/4 teaspoon garlic powder)
Parsnip Soup.notes:
Make this soup your own with more seasoning. Start with 2 to 3 teaspoons ginger, curry powder, smoked paprika, cumin, or thyme.
Margarine used for nutrition and cost analysis.

Learn more about:

Onions
Celery
Garlic
Parsnips
Potatoes

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and celery and cook until soft, about 5 minutes.
directions.3: Add the garlic, salt, and pepper; cook for1 minute.
directions.4: Stir in the parsnips, potato, broth, and water. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to simmer for 20 minutes or until the parsnips and potatoes are soft.
directions.5: Stir in the margarine or butter and let the soup sit uncovered for 5 minutes.
directions.6: Purée the soup in batches in a blender, using the manufacturer's directions for puréeing hot liquids.
directions.7: Heat the soup before serving, stirring in water if it seems too thick.

ingredients: 3 cups frozen vegetables such as carrots, broccoli, and cauliflower, thawed
Party-Time Pasta.notes:
Learn more about:

Tomatoes
Carrots
Broccoli
Cauliflower
Herbs

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Heat a large nonstick pan over medium heat. Add ground turkey and paprika. Cook and stir until meat is brown and no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
directions.3: Stir in tomatoes, chicken broth and pasta. Bring mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer until pasta is almost tender, about 10 to 15 minutes.
directions.4: Remove lid. Place vegetables on top of pasta. Replace lid. Cook until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes.
directions.5: Prepare the Tasty Topping. Mix parsley, bread crumbs and Parmesan cheese. Sprinkle over vegetables in skillet. Cover and let sit for 3 minutes before serving.

ingredients: 1 stick of butter (or margarine), unsalted (1/2 cup)
Passover Rhubarb Cobbler.notes:
Learn more about:

Rhubarb
Raspberries
Lemons

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a shallow 2-quart baking dish, combine 1 1/4 cups sugar and cornstarch*. Add rhubarb, raspberries, and lemon juice - mixing gently but thoroughly.
directions.3: Meanwhile, in a food processor or a bowl, whirl or rub together with your fingers the matzo meal, the remaining 1/2 cup sugar, margarine, and nutmeg to create fine crumbs.
directions.4: Squeeze matzo mixture to compact into lumps, then crumble over rhubarb mixture.
directions.5: Baked in a 375 °F oven until cobbler is bubbling in center and top is golden brown, about 1 hour. Let cool 15 minutes.
directions.6: Spoon cobbler into bowls and top with sorbet or whipped cream (optional).

ingredients: 1 yellow onion (peeled and chopped into 1/4 inch pieces)
2 cans 14.5-ounce low-sodium crushed or diced tomatoes (including liquid)
Pasta Bolognese.notes:
One portion equals 1 cup cooked pasta + 3/4 cup sauce.
Freeze leftover sauce for up to 1 month.

Learn more about:

Carrots
Celery
Onions
Tomatoes

directions.1: Put skillet on the stove over medium heat and when it is hot, add oil.
directions.2: Add carrot, celery, and onion and cook about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables begin to brown.
directions.3: Raise the heat to high. Pinch off tablespoon-sized pieces of the beef and add a few at a time, stirring well between additions. Cook, breaking the meat apart until it is no longer raw, starts to give off liquid, and no longer clumps together, about 10 minutes.
directions.4: Add the water, tomatoes, and tomato paste, stirring well. Cook about 10 minutes until the sauce begins to thicken.
directions.5: Slowly stir in the milk, a little bit at a time. Turn the heat down to low and cook 45 minutes until all the liquid has been absorbed.

ingredients: 4 ounces spaghetti (whole grain, regular or thin)
salt (1/8 teaspoon, optional, can omit salt and pass at the table)
1 cup peas (frozen, thawed, or 1 cup chopped tomatoes)
Pasta Frittata with Peas.notes:
Salt omitted from nutrition analysis.
Learn more about:

Peas

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F.
directions.3: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and place in a 9-inch pie plate that has been sprayed with nonstick cooking spray.
directions.4: Combine eggs, seasonings, cheese, and peas. Spread the egg mixture over the top of the spaghetti so the mixture covers the frittata and some of it sinks between the spaghetti strands.
directions.5: Bake for 20 minutes or until a knife inserted near the center comes out clean. Let frittata stand 5 minutes before serving.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook noodles according to package directions.
directions.3: While noodles are cooking, heat oil in a skillet.
directions.4: Add vegetables and sauté until tender; stir constantly.
directions.5: Add tomato and sauté 2 more minutes.
directions.6: Toss vegetables with noodles and margarine.
directions.7: Add seasonings; sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Pasta Primavera II.notes: May substitute any type of pasta for the rotini. Do not overcook the pasta and vegetables. Maybe substitute other types of canned or bottled Italian sauces.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Prepare pasta according to package directions. Add frozen vegetables during the last 5 minutes of cooking time.
directions.3: Drain pasta and vegetables and set aside.
directions.4: Bring the spaghetti sauce to a boil over medium heat.
directions.5: Stir in the pasta and vegetables.
directions.6: Top with grated Parmesan cheese.

Pasta Primavera Salad.notes: Low-fat cheddar cheese used for nutrition analysis and costing.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse in cold water to stop cooking and prevent sticking. Drain.
directions.3: Cook vegetables until just tender. Drain and cool.
directions.4: Combine cold pasta, vegetables, envelope of soup mix and salad dressing.
directions.5: Top with sliced eggs and cheese.
directions.6: Refrigerate until time to serve.

Pasta Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Celery
Bell Peppers
Carrots
Broccoli

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook pasta according to package directions.
directions.3: Drain and place in bowl or pan.
directions.4: Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
directions.5: Cool in refrigerator before serving.

ingredients: 6 ounces uncooked whole wheat pasta, cooked, drained
Pasta Salad with Herb Vinaigrette.notes:
For a different flavor or to reduce cost, use any other vinegar you have on hand.
Learn more about:

Broccoli
Tomatoes
Carrots
Herbs

directions.1: Whisk dressing ingredients in a small bowl until blended.
directions.2: Combine pasta, broccoli, tomato, and carrot in a large bowl; toss. Pour dressing over pasta mixture; toss until evenly coated. Add eggs; toss briefly.
directions.3: Refrigerate, covered, at least 4 hours to blend flavors.

Pasta Vegetable Salad.notes:
Learn more about:

Cucumbers
Tomatoes
Bell Peppers
Onions
Peas

directions.1: Wash your hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mix all ingredients in a medium-sized bowl.
directions.3: Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
directions.4: Mix again before serving.
directions.5: Refrigerate leftovers.

ingredients: 1 small yellow onion (peeled and chopped into 1/4 pieces)
8 ounces medium-size whole-wheat pasta (such as rotini or shells)
1 can 16-ounce low sodium chickpeas (drained and rinsed with cold water)
1 can 14.5-ounce low-sodium diced tomatoes (including the liquid)
Pasta with Chickpeas, Tomato, and Spinac.notes:
Kale can be used instead of spinach.
Learn more about:

Onions
Garllic
Carrots
Celery
Herbs
Tomatoes
Spinach

directions.1: To cook the pasta, fill the pot halfway with water. Bring it to a boil over high heat. When the water is boiling, add the pasta and cook until just tender, about 12 minutes. Just before draining, reserve 1 1/2 cups of the pasta water. Drain the pasta and set aside.
directions.2: While the pasta is cooking, cook the sauce: Put the skillet on the stove over medium-low heat and when it is hot, add the oil. Add the garlic, onion, carrots, celery, and rosemary and cook until the garlic is golden, about 15 minutes.
directions.3: Add the chickpeas and using the fork, lightly mash half of them. Add the reserved pasta water and tomatoes and cook 10 minutes.
directions.4: Add the pasta and spinach to the skillet mixture and cook until the spinach is tender and most of the liquid has been absorbed by the pasta, about 10 minutes. Add the red pepper flakes, if desired.
directions.5: Mix well and serve immediately, garnished with Parmesan cheese.

ingredients: 2 cups cooked chicken cubes (or 3 chicken sausages, chopped)
6 cups spinach, chopped (or 1 bunch Swiss chard)
1 can cannellini beans, low-sodium (15.5 ounces, rinsed and drained, can also use great northern or navy beans)
2 cups chicken broth, low-sodium (or vegetable broth)
Pasta with Greens, Beans, and Chicken.notes:
Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Spinach

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cook the pasta according to directions on box, and drain.
directions.3: On medium heat, add vegetable oil and onion to a large pan.
directions.4: Cook for 5 minutes, add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
directions.5: Stir in chopped chicken and cook until heated through.
directions.6: Add spinach (or chard), beans, chicken or vegetable stock, and spices.
directions.7: Add in cooked pasta and stir to combine.
directions.8: Cook for 5 minutes, until pasta is heated through.
directions.9: Add salt and pepper, to taste (optional), and garnish with Parmesan cheese before serving (optional).

ingredients: 1 can green chilies, drained, diced (4 oz)
Pea Guacamole.notes:
Learn more about:

Peas
Limes
Tomatoes
Onions
Herbs
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Mash peas until smooth.
directions.3: Add the lime juice, tomato, onion, green chilies, cilantro, garlic, salt (if using), and black pepper. Mix well.
directions.4: Serve with an assortment of raw vegetables and whole-grain tortilla chips.

ingredients: 1 cup frozen peas (can also use fresh or canned)
Pea Pesto.notes:
If using canned peas and spinach, remember to rinse them to lower salt content.
Great served over vegetables or pasta - serve hot or cold.
Switch out mayonnaise for pesto on sandwiches.
Try as a dip with carrots and broccoli.

Learn more about:

Peas
Herbs
Spinach
Garlic

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: For the pesto, add peas, Parmesan cheese, basil, spinach, walnuts and garlic into a food processor or blender.
directions.3: Add in water, oil, salt and pepper. Blend until the ingredients are combined to form a thick sauce.
directions.4: Place pesto in an airtight container. Refrigerate until needed.

ingredients: 1 1/3 cans peaches, in light syrup (15 oz. can), drained, sliced

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F. Lightly grease 9x9x2 inch casserole dish.
directions.3: Combine peaches, apples, vanilla, and cinnamon in a bowl. Toss well and spread evenly in greased casserole dish.
directions.4: Combine flour and sugar in small bowl. Cut in margarine with two knives until the mixture resembles coarse meal.
directions.5: Sprinkle flour mixture evenly over fruit.
directions.6: Bake until lightly browned and bubbly, about 20 minutes.

ingredients: 1 cup canned peaches (drained, or 1 cup of sliced fresh peaches)

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Put the ingredients in a blender. Blend well.
directions.3: Sprinkle with nutmeg if you like.
directions.4: Serve cold.

Peach Crisp.notes:
Serve the peach crisp either hot or cold. To remove the peach fuzz, you can rub the washed peach gently with a paper towel.
Learn more about:

Peaches

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 375 °F.
directions.3: Slice the peaches.
directions.4: Spread the peach slices on the bottom of the baking pan.
directions.5: Melt the margarine in a saucepan.
directions.6: In a small bowl, mix everything but the peaches. Stir until the mix is well blended.
directions.7: Sprinkle the oat mix on top of the peaches.
directions.8: Bake for 20 minutes.

Peach Sauce.notes:
Use as a topping for plain, nonfat yogurt or whole-grain waffles, pancakes, as preserves on toast, or as sauce to top grilled chicken.
For a thicker consistency, cook for 25 to 30 minutes to allow more time for the sauce to reduce.

Learn more about:

Peaches

directions.1: Drain peaches and pour into a medium saucepan with cinnamon.
directions.2: Cook on low to medium heat for 20 minutes, stirring every few minutes.
directions.3: Mash to desired consistency with either a potato masher or wooden spoon.

Peachy Peanut Butter Pita Pockets.notes:
Learn more about:

Apples
Bananas
Peaches

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Cut pitas in half to make 4 pockets and warm in the microwave for about 10 seconds to make them more flexible.
directions.3: Carefully open each pocket and spread a thin layer of peanut butter on the inside walls.
directions.4: Fill with a combination of apple, banana, and peach slices. Serve at room temperature.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Use a knife to remove the skin from the peaches, and to chop the peaches.
directions.3: Spoon the peaches into each of the 6 paper cups.
directions.4: Place the yogurt in a medium mixing bowl.
directions.5: Slowly pour and stir the orange juice into the yogurt. Mix well.
directions.6: Pour some of the juice and yogurt mix into each cup to cover the peaches.
directions.7: Place a spoon in the center of each cup.
directions.8: Cut 6 squares of aluminum foil big enough to cover the tops of cups. Stab each spoon handle through each piece of foil. The foil will hold the spoon in the center of the cup.
directions.9: Place cups in the freezer for at least 4 hours.
directions.10: Just before serving, peel the paper cups away from the pops to eat.

ingredients: 1/4 apple (thinly sliced, can also use banana)
Peanut Butter 'n Fruit-wich.notes:
Instead of whole wheat bread try crunchy graham crackers or roll up the filling in a soft tortilla. Instead of fresh fruit use canned, drained pineapple.
Learn more about:

Apples
Carrots

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Spread 2 tablespoons peanut butter on bread.
directions.3: Place fruit slices on top.
directions.4: Optional: Top with grated carrot.

Peanut Butter and Apple Wraps.notes:
This recipe could use other apples, such as Golden Delicious, Granny Smith, or Fuji. However, Red Delicious apples are the crispiest and their flavor balances the savory taste of the peanut butter.
The combination of fruit, granola, and peanut butter makes this snack packed with protein, iron, fiber, and calcium. The whole wheat tortilla and reduced-fat peanut butter keep it lower in fat.
Watch how to make this kid-friendly recipe on YouTube. 

Learn more about:

Apples

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Lay tortilla flat and spread peanut butter over 2/3 of the tortilla leaving edges at sides
directions.3: Sprinkle 2 tablespoons granola over peanut butter.
directions.4: Cut apple slices into small chunks and place them on top of the granola.
directions.5: Fold over the edges of the tortilla and roll up "burrito style."
directions.6: Eat and Enjoy.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth and creamy.
directions.3: Pour into a tall glass and garnish with a sprinkle of cocoa powder, if desired.

Peanut Butter Banana Smoothie.notes:
Watch how to make this kid-friendly recipe on YouTube.
Learn more about:

Bananas

directions.1: Peel bananas, chop into small pieces and place in freezer until hard.
directions.2: Gather all ingredients and put all ingredients in a blender.
directions.3: Blend on high until smooth.
directions.4: Pour into 2 glasses. Serve right away.

Peanut Butter Bananas.notes:
Walnuts used in nutrition analysis and for costing purposes. A cheaper option would be to use peanuts.
Learn more about:

Bananas

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel bananas. Spread the entire outside of each banana with peanut butter.
directions.3: Roll the bananas in crushed nuts, sprinkles or other items.
directions.4: Cut the bananas in one inch slices.
directions.5: Store in the refrigerator or freezer until ready to serve.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat oven to 350 °F. Lightly grease or spray with non-stick spray, a loaf pan.
directions.3: In large bowl, beat eggs. Add milk, sugar, and peanut butter. Mix well.
directions.4: In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder, and salt. Mix thoroughly.
directions.5: Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients. Mix only enough to moisten all ingredients.
directions.6: Pour into prepared pan. (Pan will be half full.) Bake for 1 hour.

ingredients: 1 cup raisins or other dried fruit
Peanut Butter Cereal Bars.notes:
Try this recipe with 4 cups of unsweetened cereal flakes instead of the rice cereal and oats.
Honey is not recommended for children under 1 year old.
To avoid peanuts or peanut butter, try sunflower seeds or sunflower seed butter.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a saucepan, bring honey to a boil.
directions.3: Reduce heat to low and stir in peanut butter.
directions.4: Add cereal, oats and raisins; mix well. Remove from heat
directions.5: Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking pan. Press mixture into pan. When cool, cut into 16 bars.
directions.6: Store in an airtight container for up to a week.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Preheat the oven to 375 °F.
directions.3: Line 12 muffin cups with paper baking cups (or grease the bottom of each cup with butter or margarine).
directions.4: Put the peanut butter and honey in a mixing bowl. Beat until well blended.
directions.5: Add the eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each egg.
directions.6: Add the milk, and mix well.
directions.7: Add the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Stir just until they are moistened. Don’t stir them too much.
directions.8: Fill each muffin cup 2/3 full.
directions.9: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.
directions.10: Put on a wire rack.
directions.11: Cool for at least 10 minutes before serving.

ingredients: 1/2 cup red or green bell pepper (chopped)
Peanut, Peach, N Pineapple Wrap.notes:
Mix the drained juices with your breakfast juice if you like.
To make them more pliable before wrapping, warm the tortillas: 10 to 15 seconds on high heat in the microwave, 3 to 5 minutes at 350 ºF in aluminum foil in the oven, or 15 seconds per side over medium-high on the stove top.

Learn more about:

Peaches
Pineapples
Bell Peppers
Lettuce

directions.1: In a medium bowl, combine peaches, pineapple, bell pepper, and cinnamon.
directions.2: Warm the tortillas.
directions.3: Spread 2 tablespoons of peanut butter on one side of each tortilla, leaving room on the edges.
directions.4: Spoon equal portions of the peach mixture over peanut butter, then top with lettuce.
directions.5: Fold the side and bottom edges of each tortilla toward the middle over the filling, then roll so the tortilla covers the filling.

ingredients: 1 sweet potato (2 cups, peeled and diced)
1 can tomatoes, low-sodium (diced, 14.5 ounces, with liquid)
green onion (optional, thinly sliced for garnish)
Peanutty Stew.notes:
Substitute 12 ounces frozen spinach for fresh.
Flavor boosters: chopped cilantro, red and green peppers, raisins.

Learn more about:

Onions
Garlic
Ginger
Sweet Potatoes
Tomatoes
Spinach

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Combine first 9 ingredients in a soup pot. Bring to boil, then turn down to medium low, cover and simmer for 10 minutes.
directions.3: Stir in peanut butter and milk. Return to gentle simmer and cook uncovered for 5 minutes.
directions.4: Stir in spinach and cook until wilted, 2 to 3 minutes. Remove from heat.
directions.5: Ladle stew into bowls and top with peanuts and green onion, if desired.

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: Peel the pears and cook in a double boiler for 15 minutes.
directions.3: Mix sugar and orange juice and cook over low flame for 5 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes.
directions.4: Place steamed pears on individual plates. Pour 1/4 of the juice mixture over each and serve.

Pear Kabobs with Strawberry Dipping Sauc.notes:
Other materials needed:

Six wooden skewers
small bowl
cutting board
can opener
paring knife
measuring spoons
platter or large plate

Learn more about:

Pears
Strawberries
Bananas
Pineapples

directions.1: Wash hands with soap and water.
directions.2: In a small bowl, combine the vanilla yogurt and strawberry preserves. Set aside.
directions.3: Thread the fruits by alternating the pears, strawberries, bananas, and pineapple onto the skewers.
directions.4: Serve the fruit skewers with a dollop of the strawberry sauce on the side.

Pear Party Salsa.notes:
Frozen or canned fruit (such as pears) can be substituted for fresh



Other materials needed:

paring knife
measuring spoons
cutting board
fruit peeler
slotted spoon
medium-sized bowl

Pears
Apples
Kiwifruits
Oranges
Lemons
